results.description:
APRIL 2016 THEME:  STORM  

A reminder, there are only a few days left to post entries to the March Contest (MONEY) which closes at midnight on the 31st.

(see upcoming themes below)

Please check contest rules if you have not already done so: http://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-photo-safari/messages/boards/thread/32726552 

A reminder that special instructions will appear on the contest album's cover image or its comments when the contest opens.

The photo album will open at 3:15 a.m. on the 1st of the month. Photos submitted after midnight on the last day of the month will not be eligible. If you post a photo and change your mind, you may delete it and replace it with a different photo before the deadline. If more than 2 photos are submitted, the first 2 will be judged; the 3rd will not.

________


FUTURE THEMES through August 2016:

I may add suggestions for some topics. You are free to use them or not. However, if something is marked with SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS, those must be followed.

May 2016: Junk  A mid-May meetup will give you the opportunity to take photos of lots of junk.  Details to be announced in April. 


June 2016: Fabric or Textile 

July 2016: Patriotic

August 2016: Paper
results.how_to_find_us: Online event, no actual meeting.
results.name: APRIL 2016 CONTEST: STORM

group.name: The Pittsburgh Photo Safari Meetup Group

results.description:
The Monthly Theme album is an online submission album.  Read the monthly theme and then submit photos that fit the theme ALL MONTH LONG online.  There is no formal meetup for this album.

Interpret the theme as you wish. Post up literal or figurative photos. It's all about being challenged by a specified theme!

This album is not open for critiques.  If you want your photo critiqued, you may post it here if it fits the monthly theme, and then post in in the Monthly Critique Album where it will be open for constructive criticism.

For more info:

http://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-photo-safari/boards/thread/28924022
results.how_to_find_us: Read the monthly theme and then submit photos ALL MONTH LONG!  There is no formal in person meetup.
results.name: April, 2016 Theme Album: YELLOW FLOWERS

results.description:
Please register here: http://www.idsa.org/events/district/2016-central-conference

No fooling—join us April Fool’s weekend, April 1–2, 2016, at one of the most dynamic art institutions in the United States—the Carnegie Museum of Art(link is external)—founded by industrialist and philanthropist Andrew Carnegie in 1895 and now home to a new retrospective exhibition of Peter Muller-Munk, FIDSA(link is external), one of the founders of what became, in 1934, the first industrial design department at a US university. It was then known as the Carnegie Institute of Technology. Now, it is the esteemed Carnegie Mellon University(link is external). Experience behind-the-scenes tours of some of the best design studios in Steel City. 

Schedule:

http://www.idsa.org/events/2016-central-conference-schedule


Great opportunity to network with designers from all over the IDSA Central District as well as meet Pittsburgh design professionals!
results.name: 2016 IDSA Central District Design Conference: Industrial “Strength” Design

venue.address_1: One Landmark North, Suite 205A, 20399 Route 19, Brandt Drive
venue.name: Quantum Counseling Services

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."
results.name: Fight Club: Ready ... Set ... Action!

group.name: Quantum CB/New Eyes: Exploring Your Infinite Possibilities

results.description:
South Hills Home and Garden Show

Enjoy FREE ADMISSION ALL THREE DAYS.


You’ll find fresh ideas and smart advice on home improvement, decorating and landscaping projects – all under one roof – at the South Hills Home Show presented by Clark Renovations, April 1 – 3 at the Iceoplex at Southpointe.
Three action-packed days of exhibits, seminars and demonstrations will educate and entertain individuals interested in information, advice and inspiration.
Show highlights will include more than 100 exhibits, hands-on demonstrations and home remodeling advice from KDKA Radio’s Andy Amrhein.
Show hours will be Friday 4 – 9 p.m., Saturday 10 a.m. – 8 p.m. and Sunday 10 a.m. – 5 p.m.
Enjoy FREE ADMISSION ALL THREE DAYS.
For show information, visit <a>www.SouthHillsHomeShow.com.</a>
results.name: South Hills Home and Garden Show

group.name: Free and Almost Free in Pittsburgh

results.description:
Hello everyone!

Another great night of gaming!  Got quite a few games to the table which included:  Favor of the Pharaoh, Five Tribes, Ticket to Ride with the PA expansion, Evolution, La Isla, Mombasa, plus a few more.  Decent turn out for a holiday weekend but I would love to see the attendance numbers continue to increase based on the numbers of new members who have joined the meetup.

I am not going to do any particular theme this week but I am going to bring out a couple of new additions to my collection which include: Kemet and Above and Below.  

If any of those games interest you please let me know down in the chat and I will be sure to bring them along.  


Looking forward to Friday night, hope to see you there!



Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play...

Party games like:  Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like:  Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico, Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like:  Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like:  Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you soon!

Russ.

Pizzas are reasonable.

results.description:
A friend of mine mentioned this awesome NEW Bar\Restaurant on Troy Hill Called "Scratch." so i decided to check it out an it's good!  OKAY TO INVITE A FRIEND OR THREE!  The DJ: TJ HARRIS is from Modern Era Weddings and he has a huge selection of music so he can play a lil bit of everything.

The Happy Hour is from 6pm to 9pm. 

6pm to 7pm is Get Nametags, Drink, Eat (great menu) Socialize!

7pm to 9pm: DJ TJ Harris will be playing a lil bit of everything.  OKAY TO MAKE REQUESTS, he has tons of choices available!

This is a meetup!  Make sure you mingle, Socialize and talk to others.  Have fun.  Don't just find a seat and stay there.  Remember most of the people don't know each other because it's cross-posted on various meetups and facebook, so don't be shy, just enjoy the food, talk, have a drink and enjoy!

I checked it out already and made arrangements with the Owner to do a 6 to 9pm BIG MULTI- MEETUP Happy Hour. We're going to have a DJ,  i am catching Dinner there from 5pm to 6pm on Friday.

YELP REVIEW for Scratch Food N Beverage: http://www.yelp.com/biz/scratch-food-and-beverage-pittsburgh

PARKING: on street parking and after 6pm you can park at the Bank Parking Lot across the street!

Hope to see you there for either Event!  (the Dinner or the Happy Hour w DJ & DANCING from 6pm to 9pm).

This Happy Hour is Cross-Posted on Multiple-Meetups and Facebook so we get a good bit of people of different backgrounds and the events are usually pretty darn good.  This would make a good FIRST - MEETUP to go to an event!
results.how_to_find_us: Be at the BAR! I'll have nametags!

results.description:
Party in the Tropics is happening once again at Phipps Conservatory.. In case you do not know what it is, Party in the Tropics is an awesome dance party with alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages and snacks. The party is free with admission, which is $15 if you are not a member.

Please try to get there by 6:45 PM since I like to be able to go into the conservatory at 7 PM. Anyone who arrives late can contact me at (412)[masked], and I can tell you where the group is.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the front lobby.  If you can't find us, or you arrive late, text me at (412) 427-6295
results.name: Party in the Tropics at Phipps Conservatory

results.description:
"Cartel land" was nominated by the Academy for Best Documentary. It's by Katheryn Bigelow (Director of Hurt Locker). To see all the awards, see http://cartellandmovie.com/ .
Also see the trailer on this page.
    
This is part of the CMU film festival. Tickets are $5 or $10 per film, or buy a festival pass for $25 for students and seniors, $50 for everyone else. Buy at http://www.cmu.edu/faces/tickets.html . This may sell out, so you can buy your ticket now.


The CMU garage on Forbes Ave is free after 5:00 pm.
     
The movie starts at 7:00 pm. Let's meet in the lobby by 6:45 pm. . McConomy Auditiorium is on the first floor in the University Center, near Forbes Ave.
results.name: "Cartel Land" the movie, at CMU

results.description:
The CMU International Film Festival explores the lives of vigilantes on both sides of the U.S. and Mexican border in this 2016 Academy Award Nominee for Best Documentary Feature!


JOIN US!  
Following the screening will be a Q&A featuring Roger Rouse, Professor of Anthropology at University of Pittsburgh, and Paul Eiss, Professor of History at CMU.  Continue the discussion at a Mexican food reception courtesy of La Palapa!

Sponsored by University of Pittsburgh’s Graduate Program for Cultural Studies.

EVENT INFO HERE | BUY TICKETS HERE

Find FREE parking at the Forbes Avenue Parking Lot after 5pm!


FILM DESCRIPTION  
“Astonishing...[Cartel Land] plays like a real-life version of some grim Sam Peckinpah Western in which violence and corruption have become endemic...as full of reversals and ironies as that of any fictional thriller.” —Geoffrey Macnab, The Independent

Tim “Nailer” Foley, a leathery veteran in army fatigues, scans Arizona’s desert brush and declares, “There’s an imaginary line out there, between right and wrong, good and evil. I believe what I am doing is good and what I am standing up against is evil.” What could possibly unite Foley, a vigilante with a paramilitary group who routinely thwarts Mexican immigrants, with a freedom fighter in Mexico? A shared enemy: the cartels. In the Mexican state of Michoacán, Dr. Jose Mireles, a small-town physician known as “El Doctor,” leads the Autodefensas, a citizen uprising against the violent Knights Templar drug cartel that has wreaked havoc on the region for years. Filmmaker Matthew Heineman embeds himself in the heart of darkness as Nailer, El Doctor, and the cartel each vie to bring their own brand of justice to a society where institutions have failed.


TRAILER

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZoSFSiLgbdI

Reception & Film Location

This event is General Admission (open seating) and takes place inside the Jared L. Cohen University Center (where the café areas are also located) next to the tennis courts.   And if you were standing on Forbes facing the main campus (near the bus shelter at Forbes & Morewood), you would see the famous 'Walking to the Sky' sculpture (where people appear to walking up a 10-story angled pole) in front of you, and the Cohen University Center would be very long building to your left. The McConomy Auditorium is on the 1st floor of the Cohen University Center. Please print out this campus map before you go http://www.cmu.edu/homeimages/campus-map/cmu_mapcolor_8x11.pdf -- the Cohen University Center is Building #13 on this map. 


Here is what the McConomy Auditorium looks like inside http://www.cmu.edu/cohon-university-center/reserve-space/event-spaces/mcconomy.html

CMU International Film Festival For the complete festival schedule and more info, including trailers of all of the films during CMU International Film Festival’s TENTH ANNIVERSARY season (March 17 - April 3, 2016), please visit http://www.cmu.edu/faces/index.html

Chef Jonathan has been entertaining guests at Alla Famiglia for the past decade with his passion for the Italian cuisine that he prepares. He exhibits a style from his experiences with his Roman grand parents Anna and Dominic Burzese, his aunts Regina, Evelyn, Normagene and of course Eleanor, his mother. It's no joke ... NO COVER!

Spend April Fool's day with Pittsburgh's newest jamband rooted in the blues - Charlie Hustle and The Grifters. Come early, grab dinner and stick around for some free music at Hambone's in Lawrenceville. No cover, 21+

About Charlie Hustle and The Grifters:
Charlie Hustle & the Grifters brings together four Pittsburgh musicians under the banner of heady musical synergy. Its members include guitarist Peter Flynn and upright bassist Trish Imbrogno of The Grifters, drummer Dave Varasse from one of Pittsburgh's premier funk bands, the Old E Allstars, and guitarist Patrick Varine. The quartet comes together and forms like Voltron! ... if Voltron consisted of two guitars, upright bass, drums and a fond desire to blend rock, folk and the blues into a gritty, tasty stew.

Hear them at https://archive.org/details/CharlieHustleAndTheGrifters?and%5B0%5D=CharlieHustleAndTheGrifters

results.description: Performance Bikes in Pittsburgh is again hosting a weekly Intermediate Ride. Yay! Join other cyclists in your community on this scenic, moderately challenging ride. Average pace is 14-16 miles per hour with a ride duration of approximately 1 hour. The intermediate route includes light urban riding, local bike paths, and residential riding. We tackle hills as they come and include at least one more challenging climb (read: over 1 mile in length). The Intermediate Ride provides an opportunity to meet new riding partners, share and build knowledge, and get a workout. This is a no-drop ride. Seasoned and very fit riders can increase ride difficulty by getting out of the saddle on climbs, as well as by down-shifting and spinning at higher cadence to build muscle suppleness. Rides start and end at the shop. Look forward to welcoming new faces this season!

results.description:
Important: Buy Tickets Here: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/introduction-to-arduino-programming-class-tickets-22747416134 

Preview of what you will learn to program in this class. Video below. 

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B22yo8yjdiiaV2NEaVZlUWtPdFk/view?usp=sharing


Important: You WILL receive an Arduino Uno if you take this class, and the knowledge to program it. If you took the soldering class, you already have an Arduino, so you will get 50% off this class. Discount Code will be handed out during Soldering class.


Soldering Class Link: http://www.meetup.com/HackPittsburgh/events/228920381/


Reminder, bring your laptops to the class!!!!

We will have 2 extra laptops in case you don't have one. 

You will be programming your Arduino and install the Arduino IDE during the class. You will receive a USB cable if you don't already have one.

Bring the arduino you soldered last Saturday if you took that class. 

Food will not be included in the cost of class, however we will be ordering Pizza together during lunch. If everyone orders together it will be very cheap. Bring cash if you want pizza. Email us if you rather have something else. As usual we have snacks for 50 cents and soda for $1. 

Class Introduction

This class will teach you the basics of Arduino Programming. Its also a celebration of Arduino Day! 

What is an Arduino you ask? Its a tiny and cheap computer which allows you to do cool stuff and build cool gadgets! Arduino is the most popular gadget used at makerspaces all over the world. It was the fuel of the maker revolution! Be a part of the revolution, learn to program one! 

Read more here: https://www.arduino.cc/en/Guide/Introduction

This class is also an introduction to C programming. C is the most popular programming language for programming embedded systems. The Linux operating system is written in it, if you know C, you can rule the world!

What will this Class Cover

This class will teach the basics of micro-controllers, Inputs and Outputs, Timing, Delays, Analog Input (Analog to Digital Converter), Basics of sensors, How to blink pretty lights at various speeds, and  how to control a real life embedded system (traffic lights at an intersection).

The basics of C will also be covered: Main(), conditional statements, loops, basic computational operations, functions, basic rules of the C language. 

What will students do in the Class

You will write the code to control two small LED traffic lights at an intersection. These will be controlled via time delays (like most real traffic lights), and sensors (turn the light green if a car is waiting). 

This will be both fun and educational. You get to keep the traffic lights and everything you built. 

You can even use the traffic lights as part of a model city like the one at Carnegie Science Center

http://www.carnegiesciencecenter.org/exhibits/miniature-railroad/


Recommended Age Group: 8-99 (kids must be accompanied by adults)

Light refreshments will be served during lunch. 

Special Discount: 

If you buy the soldering class, you get 50% off the Introductory Arduino Programming Class (Intro to C) on April 2nd (The next Saturday). Email [masked] for the discount code if you plan to buy the Soldering Class. 

For $60 you will have the knowledge to Solder, Your own Arduino, and the skills to program an Arduino, and your own traffic lights with sensors. 

Soldering Class Link: </a><a href="http://www.meetup.com/HackPittsburgh/events/228920381">http://www.meetup.com/HackPittsburgh/events/228920381

If you already know how to solder, just take the April 2nd class for $40. 



This class is in a series of  upcoming monthly classes at HackPittsburgh:

• Basic Electricity and Electronics (if you missed it, will be repeated soon)

• Learn to Solder (March 26)

• Basic Arduino Programming (April 2nd: Arduino Day)

• Advanced Arduino Programming (TBD)

• Sensors Sensors Sensors! (TBD)

• Motor Control (TBD)

• Basic Electronics Part 2: Semiconductors and op-amps (TBD)

Edit: I have just had official confirmation that State Senator Jay Costa will attend the first portion of our event. He's interested in hearing what his constituents have to say about accessibility issues and how improvements can be made. Please feel free to tell anyone you'd like about the Meet & Greet - I would love to provide an opportunity for as many people as possible to speak with the Senator.

Come meet your fellow Mobsters!

I apologize for having to cancel the initial Meet & Greet so last-minute due to health reasons; hopefully this time will be better!

We will be meeting at the new headquarters of the Three Rivers Center for Independent Living (TRCIL) at 901 Pennsylvania Avenue. There is a parking lot, and the entire facility is accessible for people using wheeled assistive devices. It's well lit, and the meeting room is quiet.

We will have one sign language interpreter, and there may be some student interpreters there to help out as needed.

Financial contributions would be gratefully accepted to offset the costs of printed materials and the hiring of interpreters at future events.

results.description:
Register Here</a>

(Please note in the description on llbean.com that the meeting location incorrectly says we are meeting at Millvale Riverfront Park)

Come explore the Three Rivers Heritage Trail with our experts. We'll meet at the <a href="http://bicycleheaven.org">Bicycle Heaven and pedal roughly 15 miles along the rivers, enjoying the sights of downtown. Please bring your bike and helmet as they are required. Show up a few minutes early so we can help you with a quick safety check on your bike. We highly recommend you bring a small day pack with extra clothes, snacks, water and any personal medications you may need.


Thank you for your interest in our free "Bike Three Rivers Heritage Trail Outing." L.L.Bean has a new centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!

Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Introduction

***Important Information***

We will be starting and finishing at Bicycle Heaven. We are not meeting at the Millvale Riverfront Park as indicated on the post on llbean.com/pittsburgh.

Your bicycle must be in good condition and ready to ride. Review the L.L.Bean Cycling Checklist to help you determine if your bicycle is in the appropriate riding condition.

Distance will be ~15 miles.

What to bring:
Bicycling helmet (Required)
Dress in layers (avoid Cotton)
Cycling gloves
Water to stay hydrated
Snacks
Spare inner tube
Cable or U-Lock
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement ﻿Click Here﻿</a>

Additional: Lip Balm, Camera, Eye Protection, Personal Medicines

Minimum Age 12: This outing is open to ages 12 and above. Children 12 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the <a href="http://files.meetup.com/3349842/Participant_Agreement_Form_Minors_110514.pdf">L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors.

Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

If you are following the campaign results, you know that Bernie needs more votes in the African American community.

From the beginning, we focused on African Americans and students.  In early Fall in became apparent that we did not to keep pursuing the students -- they were persuaded!

But we continue to need to do more outreach with black Pittsburghers.

Join us!  Go out with a partner, one of you with a Bernie sign and the other with flyers.  Talk with people and tell them why you are for Bernie.  We have found over thousands of encounters that this effort is well worth it!

Afterwards, we will gather back at Zeke's coffeehouse to gather materials and talk.  Bernie volunteers, you will find, are good people!

results.description:
Here is the trailer:

https://vimeo.com/80046272

Yula lives in Putin’s Russia. Her home is the largest garbage dump in Europe. This is the story of her life. Ten-year-old Yula has but one dream – to lead a normal life. For 14 years, Oscar-nominated filmmaker Hanna Polak follows Yula as she grows up in the forbidden territory of Svalka, the garbage dump located 13 miles from the Kremlin in Putin’s Russia. SOMETHING BETTER TO COME is Yula’s story – a dramatic tale of coming of age and maturing to the point of taking destiny into one’s own hands. It is a story of hope, courage, and life, all shot in gripping vérité style that stuns with its directness and immediacy.
       
CMU garage, off Forbes Ave, is free after 5:00 pm. This is part of the CMU film festival. For tickets, see http://www.cmu.edu/faces/tickets.html .
   
The movie starts at 7:00 pm. Let's meet in the lobby by 6:45 pm.
results.name: "Something Better To Come"  - movie at CMU

results.description:
The Italian Film Festival April 1-16 is finally here! 


7 recent Italian films, all of them Pittsburgh premieres!
All films are FREE and open to the public. Movies are in Italian with English subtitles.

April 16th - Free closing reception with in the Frick Fine Arts Cloisters! For more information: <a href="http://www.italianfimfests.org/pittsburgh"></a>http://www.italianfilmfests.org/pittsburgh.html
Italian Program at the University of Pittsburgh's photo.
‪#‎ItalianFilmFestivalPittsburgh‬ ‪#‎mondoitaliano

MAFIA AND TOMATOES "Light and entertaining comedic feeling" - IL GIORNALEPlot:

Nicola Sansone is the proprietor of a farm in Southern Italy that is confiscated by the government and assigned to a cooperative. As the cooperative is not successful, Filippo, who works in the anti-Mafia offices in the North, is sent to help. He encounters many obstacles and must resist the temptation to give up. But his sense of pride and friendships with Cosimo, the ex-farm manager, and Rossana, a beautiful and determined woman with a dark past, keep him at the cooperative. Will the anti-Mafia cooperative triumph?

A story inspired by the farm cooperatives on land confiscated from organized crime associations in many areas of Italy.Director:Giulio ManfredoniaCast:Stefano Accorsi, Sergio Rubini, Maria Rosaria Russo, Tommaso Ragno, Iaia Forte, Nicola Rignanese, Giovanni Esposito, Giovanni Calcagno, Massimo Cagnina, Michel Leroy, Debora Caprioglio, Bebo Storti, Silvio LavianoYear:2014Length:100 min.Genre:Comedy/Drama


‬
results.name: ITALIAN FILM FESTIVAL  - "Mafia & Tomatoes" (Italian with English subtitles)

results.description:
The CMU International Film Festival welcomes Director Hanna Polak from Poland to share the extraordinary story of Yula, who grew up in Europe’s largest landfill, and her courageous and daring aspirations to lead a better life.


JOIN US!  
Following the screening will be a Q&A with the film’s director, Hanna Polak.  Continue the discussion at a reception courtesy of East End Food Co-Op!

Co-Sponsored by TeleTracking Technologies, Inc. and The Consulate General of the Republic of Poland in New York.  Presented in Partnership with Pittsburgh Creative and Performing Arts School (CAPA) as part of CMU IFF’s Youth Outreach Program.

EVENT INFO HERE | BUY TICKETS HERE

Find FREE parking at the Forbes Avenue Parking Lot after 5pm!


FILM DESCRIPTION  
“An enriching experience and a remarkable project that aims and achieve to give voice to the voiceless, this lm is at once strikingly real and impressively poetic due to its genuine portrayal of the situation of extreme poverty with an underlying sentiment of optimism.” —Matt Micucci for Cinecola

Her name is Yula. She lives in Putin’s Russia. Her home is the largest garbage dump in Europe. This is the story of her life. Ten-year-old Yula has but one dream – to lead a normal life. For 14 years, Oscar-nominated filmmaker Hanna Polak follows Yula as she grows up in the forbidden territory of Svalka, the garbage dump located 13 miles from the Kremlin in Putin’s Russia. Something Better to Come is Yula’s story – a dramatic tale of coming of age and maturing to the point of taking destiny into one’s own hands. It is a story of hope, courage, and life, all shot in gripping vérité style that stuns with its directness and immediacy.


TRAILER

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9PereQR9lSk

Reception & Film Location

This event is General Admission (open seating) and takes place inside the Jared L. Cohen University Center (where the café areas are also located) next to the tennis courts.   And if you were standing on Forbes facing the main campus (near the bus shelter at Forbes & Morewood), you would see the famous 'Walking to the Sky' sculpture (where people appear to walking up a 10-story angled pole) in front of you, and the Cohen University Center would be very long building to your left. The McConomy Auditorium is on the 1st floor of the Cohen University Center. Please print out this campus map before you go http://www.cmu.edu/homeimages/campus-map/cmu_mapcolor_8x11.pdf -- the Cohen University Center is Building #13 on this map. 


Here is what the McConomy Auditorium looks like inside http://www.cmu.edu/cohon-university-center/reserve-space/event-spaces/mcconomy.html

CMU International Film Festival For the complete festival schedule and more info, including trailers of all of the films during CMU International Film Festival’s TENTH ANNIVERSARY season (March 17 - April 3, 2016), please visit http://www.cmu.edu/faces/index.html

results.description:
The Way of ECK Perfection

“All that is life is the ECK [the Holy Spirit].  The eternal paradox and eternal truth of ECK is within all.... [It works] slowly and quietly to bring about spiritual change which is the true purpose of the Sugmad [God].”

– The Shariyat-Ki-Sugmad, Book 1, p. 210; Combined Book 1 & 2, p. 210


The Eckankar Center of Western PA invites you to gather with others who have been touched by God’s love.


The ECK Worship Service lasts about one hour and is made up of three spiritual parts.  It begins with a short and uplifting reading from the works of Eckankar.  Following the reading, everyone is invited to sing HU, an ancient name for God.  The song of HU can open one’s heart to the love of God.  Anyone can benefit from this song of spiritual love regardless of age, background, or religion.  The HU song closes with a few moments of quiet contemplation and is followed by an open discussion of the morning’s topic.

For more information, visit:

<a>Http://www.meetup.com/eckankarofpa</a>

(Sponsored by the Pennsylvania Satsang Society, Inc. a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR. Religion of the Light and Sound of God.)

~and~

<a>Http://www.eckankar.org</a>

Official main site of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God 

~also~


To hear the HU Song, visit <a>www.hearhu.org.</a>

<a>
</a>

For information on Western PA Eckankar events call:[masked]

The terms ECKANKAR, ECK, and Mahanta among others are trademarks of ECKANKAR. Copyright© 2015 ECKANKAR all rights reserved. P.O.Box 2000, Chanhassen, MN[masked]

results.description:
VOTED as 1 of 10 TOP THINGS TO DO IN PITTSBURGH by the Pittsburgh Magazine!

http://www.pittsburghmagazine.com/Pittsburgh-Magazine/April-2012/Top-10/

About Italiano-Espresso©:

Italiano-Espresso was created with the idea of having weekly conversation get-togethers for all Italophiles to meet, practice and/or learn something Italian or in Italian.

Each week, there is one suggested/scheduled activity that will engage all speakers (from beginners to advanced and natives) in a fun and welcoming atmophere.

Spontaneous conversation is also welcome.

For those looking for a more structured learning environment, come and join us on Tuesdays (beginners) or Thursdays (intermediate) for Italian class (6:45pm/Wilkins School Community Center).

Italiano-Espresso is mainly held in coffeshops (i.e. the name "Italiano Espresso) and the location is chosen by the attendees on a monthly bases.

So, com'on out if you'd like to see us bring ITALIANO-ESPRESSO in your neck of the woods.

BIG NEWS: we have a BLOG!


The blog of Italiano Espresso is now online!

Wanna know more about our meetings? Check here the funniest topics we mention every Sunday: http://mondoitaliano.tumblr.com/

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the ones playing games.

results.description:
The CMU International Film Festival will close with a film that investigates one of America’s deepest contemporary conflicts: income inequality.  Co-director Jared P. Scott will join us after the screening to discuss this cinematic documentary that will leave you with a conviction for change and action.  


JOIN US!  
Following the screening will be a Q&A with co-director Jared P. Scott.  Stick around afterwards for our Closing Night Reception!

Sponsored by University of Pittsburgh’s Department of Philosophy.

EVENT INFO HERE | BUY TICKETS HERE

Find FREE parking at the Forbes Avenue Parking Lot after 5pm!


FILM DESCRIPTION  
“...a potent primer on inequality in America.” —John DeFore, The Hollywood Reporter

Through riveting and candid conversation, Noam Chomsky, regarded as one of the most important intellectuals alive today, provides the de nitive discourse on the “Two Americas.” Filmed over the course of four years, the Chomsky interviews expose how a half-century of policies have created a state of unprecedented economic inequality: concentrating wealth in the hands of a few at the expense of everyone else.

At times deeply personal, these interviews take a closer look at Chomsky’s own activism and political involvement as well as diving into his profound insight on the death of the middle class and the end of functioning democracy. Requiem For the American Dream provides a unique opportunity to introduce Chomsky to a broader audience and to widen the discussion regarding events that deeply impact all of our lives. It’s an eye-opening vision of the American Dream and one not to be missed.


TRAILER

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zI_Ik7OppEI

Reception & Film Location

This event is General Admission (open seating) and takes place inside the Jared L. Cohen University Center (where the café areas are also located) next to the tennis courts.   And if you were standing on Forbes facing the main campus (near the bus shelter at Forbes & Morewood), you would see the famous 'Walking to the Sky' sculpture (where people appear to walking up a 10-story angled pole) in front of you, and the Cohen University Center would be very long building to your left. The McConomy Auditorium is on the 1st floor of the Cohen University Center. Please print out this campus map before you go http://www.cmu.edu/homeimages/campus-map/cmu_mapcolor_8x11.pdf -- the Cohen University Center is Building #13 on this map. 


Here is what the McConomy Auditorium looks like inside http://www.cmu.edu/cohon-university-center/reserve-space/event-spaces/mcconomy.html

CMU International Film Festival For the complete festival schedule and more info, including trailers of all of the films during CMU International Film Festival’s TENTH ANNIVERSARY season (March 17 - April 3, 2016), please visit http://www.cmu.edu/faces/index.html

**RUEDA DE BACHATA 6-WEEK SERIES!!**


Join us for an exciting new 6-week series to take your Bachata skills to the next level!! Rueda de Bachata carries the same concept as Rueda de Casino, but instead with Bachata steps and music. Couples dance in a circle while there is a caller who calls out the steps. Check out this video to see how Rueda de Bachata comes together:


https://youtu.be/-FGjjH3ODgI

In this series, our goal is to HAVE FUN while learning a new concept!! This style of dance is growing very quickly and something that you will start to see in weekly socials in the Pittsburgh area. Be the first to learn and understand how to put this concept into action. This series is open to all dance levels, as there are 100s of moves that can be incorporated into the course. Let’s see how far we can challenge ourselves!!


Space is limited so reserve your spot today! 


When: 

-Sundays 6:00pm, starting February 28th


Duration:

-February 28th to April 3rd 


Where: 


-Absolute Ballroom Dance Center of Pittsburgh

6617 Hamilton Aveunue

Pittsburgh, PA 15206


Cost:


GOLD PACKAGE - $50

-Includes Week Rueda de Bachata Series


PLATNIUM PACKAGE - $75

-Includes 6 Week Rueda de Bachata Series + entry to Absolute Salsa on Sundays following each Rueda class


Link to purchase online:

"The Revenant" won Oscars for Leading Actor (Leonardo DiCaprio), Cinematography, and Directing.

While exploring the uncharted wilderness in 1823, legendary frontiersman Hugh Glass (Leonardo DiCaprio) sustains injuries from a brutal bear attack. When his hunting team leaves him for dead, Glass must utilize his survival skills to find a way back home to his beloved family. Grief-stricken and fueled by vengeance, Glass treks through the wintry terrain to track down John Fitzgerald (Tom Hardy), the former confidant who betrayed and abandoned him.

The Cost to attend? $0.00 BUT we do ask that you help us attract the most diverse (industry and background) set of entrepreneurs and create the most inclusive environment - this means inviting and bringing people, not just attending and participating.  


You can help us spread the word on Twitter or on Instagram or anywhere you can publish www.UnstuckPittsburgh.com using #UnstuckPgh 

Guidelines for the meet up:


1) Be on time, when you come in late (after 7:55AM) then you cause a disruption for everyone who got there on time.  Parents get a pass if they had to send someone off to school but otherwise please make best efforts to be early (help set up), get coffee, use the restroom, etc before we start.

2) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

3) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

results.description:
$69/player special.  Full teams and individuals have already signed up via our website. So don't be shy! 

Men’s & Coed League @ Peters Township Community Rec Center

This is a BRAND NEW facility located about 40 minutes south of downtown. Two beautiful hard wood courts will be in play. Great locker rooms and amenities. This is an AMAZING value as we launch our new leagues and welcome new players. Note that this is a 6 week program to start. Spring will start in early April and returning winter teams will have priority placement.

Sign up as an individual - great way to meet new friends! - with a group of friends - or as a full team.  

Choose from:

Monday April 4th 6pm-9pm

What's included in the  price? 

• 6 weeks of regular season plus up to two weeks of playoffs

• 2 paid referees + scorekeeper

• Two 20 minutes halves


• Championship prize for winning team: Choice of customized apparel or trophy!

• Food/Drink specials at sponsor bar

Format  
Full Court

When are we playing?  
This league plays a round robin regular season with game times rotating from 6:00 PM through 9:00 PM. A full season schedule and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2. 

Playing surface and what to wear:  
We play on a hardwood court. Athletic shoes are required. Teams must wear same-colored, permanent numbered shirts.

Level of competition:

- Recreational level is ideal for teams just forming, teams with a mix of experienced and novice players and maybe teams that have lost a step or two over the years and are looking for a more relaxed environment. 

- Intermediate level is for teams and players looking for a faster and more skilled atmosphere. Everyone playing has either played high school, club ball or IM's in college, knows the game and is solid in all fundamentals and sharp in certain skills. 


These leagues are happening! Don't see a bunch of people registered here? Don't worry! Many people and teams register directly on our sportsmonster.net website instead. So go ahead and sign up to play! 

Full Team Registration
*Want to Register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 10. And yes, you can pay for all of them here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP. 

When will I find out which team I'm on? 
Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season. 

Don't have PayPal? You may register through Sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site. 

If you have any questions please don't hesitate to ask.  
Call: [masked] 
E-mail: ryan @ sportsmonster.net

All registrations made through this Meetup event agree to the terms and conditions found on sportsmonster.net.

results.description:
Please note this event is run by a group outside the Pgh Tech Meetup - to attend you MUST RSVP at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/tripling-the-bottom-line-what-community-engagement-means-for-the-innovation-sector-tickets-23957423298

Tripling the Bottom Line: What Community Engagement Means for the Innovation Sector
Society is looking to business for solutions to local problems. Investors are seeking opportunities that combine social good along with financial results. The Tech sector provides both market based solutions and rich opportunities to connect them with communities and their aspirations. Jean Case will draw from her early experience at AOL and now from her perspectives at the Case Foundation to share her view of how the Technology sector can and must triple its bottom line of financial, social and environmental impact through community engagement.

Jean Case is a philanthropist, investor and a pioneer in the world of interactive technologies. She and her husband Steve Case held top leadership positions at AOL and founded the Case Foundation in 1997. A passionate believer in all things digital and the potential of technology to change the world for the better, Jean and her team focus its efforts on addressing significant social challenges, harnessing the best impulses of entrepreneurship, innovation, technology and collaboration to drive exponential impact.

The session is co-moderated by Ilana Diamond of AlphaLab Gear and Kathy Buechel of the Philanthropy Forum at GSPIA. There will be ample time for question & answers from attendees.

This event is free and open to the public, but limited seating is available. Register early to guarantee your spot.
results.name: EXTERNAL: An Evening With Tech Innovator and Philanthropist Jean Case

results.description: Perhaps the most underestimated line in the bible is 1 John 4:8 where it says "God is love." What doesn't that verse say? It doesn't say that God is a barrel-chested white man with a long flowing white beard sitting on a throne, looking like King Triton from The Little Mermaid, ready to cast us into a burning pit of fire if he disapproves of our behaviors. What does that verse say? Religions might make it about Big Daddy In the Sky, but every spiritual discipline agrees that LOVE answers everything. In this group we define what love really is and look at the teachings of other time-honored spiritual philosophies.

results.description:
Western Pennsylvania's Fastest Growing Square and Modern Pattern Dance Group

Lisa, a member of BCOA group has asked to cross-post this weekly event in Independence Township (Beaver County) to get the word out for those who live in the Western suburbs.earn to SQUARE DANCE! 

Modern Pattern Dancing combines the simplicity and excitement of Contra dancing with the versatility and smoothness of Modern Western Style Square Dancing.  There are a bunch of regulars that show up to this, and in addition we normally get a some people from the MEETUPS every once in a while.  It's a fun time!

Independance Twp. Community Center

116 School Rd. , Aliquippa 15001, PA

It is danced to modern music ranging from Country to Hip Hop and is not confined to square formations. Pairs, Triangles, Rectangles, Hexagons, Kaleidoscopes, Sicilian Circle and many others formations are also employed. Couples, Singles, and groups of all ages are always welcome.

No experience necessary 
Admission $5.00 includes lesson and light refreshments 
Every Monday 7:00 to 10.00 PM

Here's the Modern SQUARE and Pattern Dance Meetup if you like this then JOIN that meetup! http://www.meetup.com/Greater-Pittsburgh-Square-and-Modern-Pattern-Dance-Group/

FYI: Scott Brown

This group does meet every Monday,and is open to everybody including beginners. The average attendance is between 16 to 25 people. Beginners should come at 7:00 for an introduction

The Gold Rush Outlaws Western Square and Modern Pattern Dance Group meets every Monday night from 7:00 PM to 10:00 PM near the Greater Pittsburgh Airport.  2 miles off the Hopewell exit of the parkway 376/old rt 60. (rt 151)  New dancers are always welcome and should come at 7:00 PM for the first dance to learn the steps needed for the following ones.    Dancers learn at their own pace and pick up where they left off at their next visit.   We are open to all ages and lifestyles, and have three International recording artists on our staff to serve you. Join us for a night and see what we have to offer.

There are also a couple other events each month where you can go and practice what you've learned and learn the next few steps as well.    I've gone almost 1/2 dozen times and am really enjoying it.   the ages range from (guessing here) late teens/early 20s to 70s with a pre-teen and teens at some of the additional events.  fun for all,   they match us newbies with partners who know what they are doing to start off, but don't worry, you don't stay with that partner the whole time as the square mixes, matches and intermingles and you can progress quickly or take your time moving up if you need to.   Tons of fun, you have to try it.  

No specific attire required,  street clothes, jeans, tennies & t-shirts, or dress up in your favorite western wear.  just wear COMFORTABLE low heeled shoes, cowboy boots etc as you do a lot of moving and don't want to be falling over in heels or having sore feet.  

Main page

results.description:
Looking For Group in Brookline is trying to get more people interested in game making and design. Jon Cassie from Game Level Learn will be presenting an introduction to game design series in our space. These classes will be focused on physical (table-top) games.

Classes are every monday in April at 7 pm. The first three classes are one hour each, and the capstone is double the fun for two hours. Attendees are welcome to stay until the store closes at 10 pm for mingling about game design or just to play some games in our LAN center. You don't need to do them all. Come to the ones that are exciting to you. More importantly, tell you friends who are on the fence about making games to come.

Week 1 – 4/04 – Game Design 101: Introduction to basic concepts of game design.

Week 2 – 4/11 – Authentic Worldbuilding: Creating believable cultures for all kinds of gaming contexts.

Week 3 – 4/18 – The Four Faces of Every Game: Detail on the four fundamental types of games.

Week 4 – 4/25 – Get in the Game!: 2 Hour session on gamification or gameified motivation for classrooms, workplaces, or other settings.

https://www.lfgpgh.com/index.php/event/game-design-101/?instance_id=527
results.name: Introduction to Game Making Lecture/Workshop Series

Come and play ukulele with us at the Unitarian Universalist Church of the North Hills on the first and third Mondays of each month. All levels of play are welcome, and we are novice-friendly. Some people who come have never even held a ukulele, and if you contact Sandy ahead of time, she will bring an extra ukulele for you to try. Try Ukulele.... It's Really Fun!

Music is usually selected from "The Daily Ukulele... 365 Songs for Better Living," by Liz and Jim Beloff. This book is readily available at music stores, book stores, and Amazon.com.  Sometimes members bring other music to play (bring 15 copies to share). We play seated at a large conference table. Bring a table-top music stand if you have one.

Snacks and libations to share are welcome.

For more information, contact Sandy at [masked]

Directions to the Church: Take I279 North to Wexford exit. Turn right at the end of the exit. Right at the light onto Brandt School Road. Right onto West Ingomar Road to 2359. Note: Watch for the large Church sign and turn right, then you will follow a narrow road back through the trees to the Church. We meet in a room just inside the door. If you are driving North from Pittsburgh on I-279, take Exit 8 Camp Horne Road, Go north and then take Rochester Road. West Ingomar Road is just past the Franklin Inn (turn right and then a quick left, and the Church driveway is in sight on your left.

Look for this sign. Note: it is lit at night

results.description:
If you've never explored the Morton Valley Trail in Boyce-Mayview Park, you'll be in for a treat!  It's beautiful to walk through and has been rated one of the best walking trails in the city!   We will walk at a slow to moderate pace for about an hour.  Wear waterproof hiking shoes/ boots and dress accordingly to walking on trails that may be a bit muddy.  Bring a water bottle and snack if you'd like.  

Directions from US Rt. 19 (Washington Road)


Proceed south on US Rt. 19 (Washington Road) to Boyce Road which is 3.0 miles south of South Hills Village Shopping Center (at Ft. Couch Road). Turn right onto Boyce Road and proceed 0.5 miles to the intersection with Morton Road on the right. Turn right and then immediately left into the garden plot parking area (indicated by “A” on the map).

If the gate to the garden plots is closed or as an alternate, continue on Boyce Road another 0.6 miles to the paved turn-off just before Ardolino's Pizza on the right 

Another alternate entrance is on Mayview Road. Continue on Boyce Road to the intersection with Mayview Road (next traffic light) and turn right. Proceed 1.1 miles on Mayview Road to the railroad track crossing (indicated by “C” on the map). Park in the small triangle of land on the west side of Mayview Road bordered by the railroad tracks and Chartiers Creek. (There is room for only 2 or 3 cars.) Cross Mayview Road and enter the park through the gate to the wetlands.

Directions from Interstate 79

Take Bridgeville exit (No. 54) from I-79. At the end of the exit ramp, turn right onto Millers Run Road (PA Route 50) and proceed to the traffic light at the T-instersection with Washington Pike in front of the Exxon station. Turn right onto Washington Pike and drive for for 2.1 miles to the intersection with Boyce Road. Turn right onto Boyce and proceed 1.4 miles to the traffic light at the intersection with Mayview Road.

If you want to enter the park through the wetlands, turn left on to Mayview road and drive for 1.1 miles to the railroad track crossing (indicated by “C” on the map). Park in the small triangle of land on the west side of Mayview Road bordered by the railroad tracks and Chartiers Creek. (There is room for only 2 or 3 cars.) Cross Mayview Road and enter the park through the gate to the wetlands.

To use the Boyce Road entrances to the park, continue on Boyce Road for another 0.5 mile to Ardolino's Pizza on the left. There is a paved turn off and parking area just past the pizza shop.

You can also use the garden plot parking area at the intersection with Morton Road. Proceed another 0.6 mile to the intersection with Morton Road on the left. Turn left and then another immediate left into the parking area (indicated by “A” on the map).

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!

results.description:
DISGRACED

March 10 - April 10, 2016

by Ayad Akhtar

Amir is a hot-shot corporate lawyer in Manhattan. He’s also a Pakistani-American whose white wife is an artist interested in Islamic forms. When Amir is mistakenly linked to a Muslim leader, his world begins to unravel. Matters come to a head when he and his wife host a dinner party for another power couple – a Black female attorney and her Jewish husband. This 90-minute thrill ride won the 2013 Pulitzer Prize for Drama. This is your chance to see why.

This Pittsburgh Public Theater production of "Disgraced" will feature an amazing cast and set. 


Check out these great articles and reviews of the show http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/theater-dance/2016/03/10/Stage-preview-Pittsburgh-Public-Theater-and-Pulitzer-on-the-same-page-again-with-Disgraced/stories/201603100005

http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/fajer-kaisi-stars-in-the-publics-production-of-disgraced/Content?oid=1900673

http://triblive.com/aande/theaterarts/10038456-74/brigden-says-amir

http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/theater-dance/2016/03/22/Stage-review-Public-Theater-s-Disgraced-expertly-builds-toward-explosive-twist/stories/201603220014

http://triblive.com/aande/theaterarts/10169891-74/theater-amir-disgraced

http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/disgraced-at-pittsburgh-public-theater/Content?oid=1906077

http://www.pghintheround.com/disgraced/

About the Sips & Scripts! Offer

EVENT DETAILS

The Sips & Scripts! pre-show reception begins at 5:30 pm in the 2nd floor multipurpose room.


KNOW BEFORE YOU GO 

Read DISGRACED before the April 5th performance - the more you know, the more you'll be able to contribute to the conversation! See below for a few ways to get your own copy of the script.

LIKE A BOOK CLUB, ONLY BETTER 

Take part in a pre-show reception featuring complimentary wine, cheese from <a></a>Wisconsin Cheese Masters and a beer tasting hosted by Helltown Brewing. The reception will culminate in a round-table discussion about various themes found throughout DISGRACED and the chance for all participants to voice their thoughts about the play before seeing it live on stage at that evening's 7:00pm performance. Doors open for the reception at 5:30pm with the discussion beginning at 6:00pm sharp, so please arrive promptly.

CHAT WITH THE CAST 

Following the show, take the discussion even further with a talkback led by members of the  DISGRACED cast. 

The Sips & Scripts! offer is a great deal -- while regular ticket prices are in the range of $30-$60 (depending on how close you sit to the stage), the Sips & Scripts! is only $25 which is also includes the pre-show reception with complimentary wine/cheese/beer and social activities.  Tickets for SIPS & SCRIPTS are $25 and include event entry and best available seating for the April 5th performance of DISGRACED. Participants must be 21+ to attend and must present valid ID. The $25 purchase price does not include a copy of the script. Tickets are limited and can only be ordered by phone at[masked] ext. 704.

TO ORDER Sips & Scripts! TICKETS

To order $25 Sips & Scripts! seats, please call Casey/Pittsburgh Public Theater [masked] x704) and let her know whether:


A) Pick your Own Seats -- For example, if you wish to sit as close to the stage as possible or if you're going with family/friends instead.  

B) Sit with Other People in the Meetup Group


Please contact Casey directly at[masked] x704. Typical office hours are M-F 9am-5pm.


There are limited Sips & Scripts! tickets, so please don't wait too long as this offer may sell out in advance.


Please note that people will have a lot of time for socializing during the Sips & Scripts! reception from 5:30-6:45 PM. And people can also talk more after the show and Cast Q&A discussion; for example, if they'd like to go for a quick drink after the show.

As always, it is also fine if you wish to enjoy this show on your own with family and friends instead. 

REGULAR TICKETS

Of course, if you can't make the Sips & Scripts! on April 5, please consider checking out this wonderful play on one of the other performance dates (March 10, 2016 - April 10, 2016) as shown below.

For more information about this show or to order regular tickets, please visit http://ppt.org/shows/view/95

For more information about the Pittsburgh Public Theater and other upcoming productions as part of PPT's[masked] season, please visit http://ppt.org/

Your Script Awaits A limited number of scripts are available for purchase through Pittsburgh Public Theater by calling[masked] ext. 704. Scripts can also be bought online through various retailers including

THE DRAMA BOOKSHOP

<a></a>AMAZON

</a> Who's On Tap <a href="http://click.skem1.com/click?a6f06-1gzrr3-1hre8ft3">Click here to learn more about Mount Pleasant's own Helltown Brewing, who will be on hand to host the evening's beer tasting during the pre-show reception.

See Us On Screen Click here to check out our latest TV commercial before you see the show!

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.

results.description:
CELEBRATED FILMMAKER JULIE DASH

SPENDS AN EVENING AT THE LOCAL LIBRARY

Pittsburgh-based Sembène – The Film & Arts Festival is very pleased to host a special event - AN EVENING WITH JULIE DASH. 


Internationally renown filmmaker and writer Julie Dash joins us for an informal Q&A and a screenings of clips from her extensive filmography on Tuesday, April 5th, at 5:30 PM at the Carnegie Library -Homewood, located at 7101 Hamilton Avenue, in Pittsburgh. Filmmaker Billy Jackson will moderate the talk/Q&A and a desert reception follows. 


AN EVENING WITH JULIE DASH is free and open to the public but you must register on EVENTBRITE https://www.eventbrite.com/e/an-evening-with-julie-dash-tickets-22276330103. 

AN EVENING WITH JULIE DASH is a co-presentation of Sembène - The Film & Arts Festival, Center for Arts in Society at Carnegie Mellon University and The Requiem for Rice.


Julie Dash will be in the city because she is part of the creative team of THE REQUIEM FOR RICE, a national multimedia event. CMU's Center for Arts in Society is one of the development sites for The Requiem for Rice. Dr. Edda Fields-Black, of CMU,describes The Requiem For Rice as

"a lamentation for the repose of the souls of the dead who were enslaved, exploited, and brutalized on Lowcountry South Carolina and Georgia's rice plantations and who remain unburied, unmourned, and unmarked. It is a modern, African and African-American inspired take on a classic requiem."

About The Requiem for Rice


The Requiem for Rice is a collaboration between the Colour of Music, Charleston’s Black Classical Music Festival, and the Lowcountry Rice Culture Forum, sponsored by the Lowcountry Rice Culture Project. Carnegie Mellon University's Center for the Arts in Society selected The Requiem for Rice as its Performance Initiative for 2015-2017. Pittsburgh and CMU will be the incubator and a creative space for The Requiem to develop. The Requiem for Rice is sponsored by the Carnegie Mellon University Center for Arts in Society Performance Initiative and the University of Pittsburgh African Heritage Classroom Committee. For more information about The Requiem for Rice visit http://www.requiemforrice.com/index.html.

About Julie Dash
Julie Dash’s first feature — Daughters of the Dust (1991) — was the first film by an African American woman to receive a general theatrical release in the United States; the Library of Congress named it to the National Film Registry in 2004. Dash returned to the film’s characters and their Gullah milieu in her novel of the same title, published in 1999.


Born in New York City, Julie Dash is a filmmaker, music video and commercial director, author and website creator. Her film studies began in Harlem in 1969, but eventually led her to the American Film Institute and UCLA, where she made The Diary of an African Nun (1977), based on a short story by Alice Walker, which won a student award from the Directors Guild of America. Dash’s critically acclaimed short film Illusions (1982) later won the Jury Prize for Best Film of the Decade awarded by the Black Filmmakers Foundation.
Her television films include “Love Song” (2000), starring R&B singer Monica Arnold, the romantic thriller “Incognito” (1999), and the domestic drama “Funny Valentines” (1999). Dash was nominated for a Directors Guild Award for “The Rosa Parks Story” (2002) starring Angela Bassett.


She has directed music videos for Tony! Toni! Toné!, Keb’ Mo’, Peabo Bryson, Adriana Evans, Sweet Honey in the Rock and Tracy Chapman.
When not working on her projects, Dash is a frequent lecturer at many leading universities, including Stanford University, Princeton, Harvard and Yale. 


⌘⌘⌘⌘
For inquiries into the community forum only (AN EVENING WITH JULIE DASH), please contact Sabira Bushra at (412)[masked] or [masked]. 

For all other inquiries regarding Julie Dash and The Requiem for Rice, please contact Edda Fields-Black, Ph. D., (412)[masked] or [masked].

http://www.colourofmusic.org/
The Lowcountry Rice Culture Project
http://www.lowcountryriceculture.org/
The Requiem for Rice
https://www.requiemforrice.com Sembène - The Film & Arts Festival

results.description:
Kiva Zip micro-loans have helped over 100 Pittsburgh business owners from a range of industries, neighborhoods and backgrounds to pursue their dreams while strengthening our local economy. Kiva City Pittsburgh and Vernard Alexander Enterprises (PA’s most active Kiva Zip trustee!) invite you to join us as we celebrate Inclusive Innovation Week with local Kiva Zip borrowers, trustees, and lenders.

Come out to mingle and network with Kiva Zip entrepreneurs and supporters while you enjoy food and drink from Scratch food & beverage, a new craft bar and restaurant in the Troy Hill neighborhood of Pittsburgh. Scratch has generously offered to lend a portion of proceeds from the evening to local business owners who are crowdfunding with Kiva Zip on the day of the event!

Not a Kiva Zip borrower, trustee, or lender (yet)? Even better! This casual evening will be a great way to learn about Kiva Zip's unique 0% interest, crowdfunded loans from people who are directly involved.

So, join Kiva City Pittsburgh and Vernard Alexander Enterprises as we celebrate Inclusive Innovation Week and crowdfund a stronger Pittsburgh economy.

results.description:
Let's head out to the North Hills, to the Cheesecake Factory at Ross Park Mall!  Located conveniently off of McKnight Road, we can enjoy a 5pm Happy Hour and a 6pm sit down dinner at this easy to locate restaurant. 

Please make sure that you RSVP if you would like to join us for dinner (Please do NOT rsvp if ONLY attending the Happy Hour. Just leaving a comment would be fantastic! ). 

At this moment, we only have reservations available for 15 people.  But I will request more seats if our RSVPs fill up.  And of course, if you RSVP, but then find out that you cannot attend, please delete your RSVP, as space may be limited for dinner.  We look forward to seeing you!

It is PPDC's strict policy that any unannounced no-shows to a dinner will result in that member being BLOCKED from the group.  Also, to help me avoid the evil glares from restaurant managers when our dinner attendance numbers suddenly drop by half, if a member backs out (but gives advance notice) TWICE during their membership, they will also be BLOCKED from the group.  This is a very strict policy, and we strongly recommend that you do NOT reserve for a dinner until you are sure that you can attend.  This is very important, because I am being told that people are being discouraged from attending due to the events being "fully booked."  Thanks!!!

A donation of a dollar per person would be appreciated, but not required, as the website is not free (please do not donate electronically).  Yes, we accept quarters lollll....

Until then...!
results.how_to_find_us: During the Happy Hour, we will likely be wearing small 1/2 sized name tags. And of course, for dinner, you may ask the host if our group has been seated yet. I will also keep an eye out on the comment section of our event on Meetup.com that night.

results.description:
Experience the classic Italian opera "The Barber of Seville" by Gioachino Rossini which has thrilled audiences since its premiere in 1816 in Rome, Italy. "The Barber of Seville" has proven to be one of the greatest masterpieces of comedy within music, and has been described as the opera buffa of all "opere buffe". Even after two hundred years, it remains an extremely popular work that is frequently performed and appears 8th on the Operabase list of the most-performed operas worldwide.


Rossini’s madcap comedy is guaranteed to send you out laughing and humming a tune. 

Count Almaviva is in love with the beautiful Rosina. Rosina is essentially being held captive by the slimy Bartolo, who wants to marry her himself. With the help of the barber Figaro, Almaviva and Rosina attempt to outwit Bartolo and live happily ever after.


While the original popular romantic comedy was based on an 18th-century play set in Seville, Spain, the new look for Pittsburgh Opera's production will update the story by staging it in the Hollywood era around 1950.

THE BARBER OF SEVILLE is the perfect introductory opera. It features recognizable music, comedic staging, fun costumes and a happy ending.


But THE BARBER OF SEVILLE will be LARGER THAN LIFE because of the amazing ensemble cast - which includes two former Resident Artists with tremendous personalities, Kevin Glavin and Jonathan Beyer - and the Pittsburgh debut of Michele Angelini, who has received superlative reviews around the world in his role. Antony Walker conducts.


Please note that this production will be sung in the original Italian with projected English titles.

Check out these great articles and reviews of this production http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music/2016/04/03/Review-Pittsburgh-Opera-gives-classic-Barber-of-Seville-a-Hollywood-makeover/stories/201604030259

http://triblive.com/aande/music/10227567-74/barber-opera-pittsburgh

http://www.pghintheround.com/the-barber-of-seville/

http://www.nextpittsburgh.com/events/pittsburgh-opera-present-a-fresh-new-take-on-the-barber-of-seville/

http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music/2016/03/30/Opera-Preview-Pittsburgh-Opera-s-Barber-of-Seville-opens-with-one-of-opera-s-most-famous-arias/stories/201603310039

http://www.pittsburghmagazine.com/Best-of-the-Burgh-Blogs/The-412/March-2016/For-Pittsburgh-Native-Opera-is-a-Laughing-Matter/

http://triblive.com/aande/moreaande/10122474-74/opera-barber-rosina

To check out example videos of this Pittsburgh Opera production (so you can get a feel for the music, actors, costumes, scenes, set design, etc. but without the english translations), please visit http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwopera/videoplay.cfm?colid=1294390#

Check out these example videos of several scenes from other productions of"The Barber of Seville"  where some english translations are also included

https://youtu.be/TCUNvCjLrTo?list=PL3yrlvmdaUwjzVUg6Eo2HDOdM-U-_uLjF&t=11

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7qHZkkgowdY


Meetup Ticket Discount Offer

Pittsburgh Opera is very graciously offering the Meetup a fantastic deal for great seats for a wonderful experience with powerful music and stunning set/costumes.

And for even more flexibility, Pittsburgh Opera is offering the discount for two performance dates (so we'll be scheduling Meetup dates for each one) 

  Tuesday, April 5 at 7 PM 

  Friday, April 8 at 7:30 PM

Meetup members can purchase tickets to either performance for the following special prices:

$50 for best available in Sections A & B (regularly $102.75 to $157.75 in value) which are equivalent to the best seats on the Orchestra Floor or Directors Circle with fantastic views to the stage.

$30 for best available in Sections C & D (regularly $42.75 to $79.75) which are equivalent to really good seats on the Orchestra Floor or First Tier/lower Second Tier in the balcony with great views to the stage.

This is a very generous offer and a wonderful opportunity to experience opera, especially for those that perhaps have never checked out classic opera before.  Naturally, this offer is not intended to be a substitute for Pittsburgh Opera[masked] subscriptions which also have many benefits.

If you prefer going on Friday, April 8 instead, please RSVP to other Meetup posting http://www.meetup.com/Art-lovers/events/229596013/

With this special Meetup offer, please note that you will be seated on the day of the show with the best available seating in your selected sections. Pick up your tickets at the Benedum Center Box Office Will Call starting 2 hours before your performance.  To take advantage of this special Meetup offer, please go online https://pct.formstack.com/forms/operaforms_op16_meet_up_offer_the_barber_of_seville Just click "Continue" below and follow the steps to place your order. Confirm your seating selection, then select the number of seats, and provide your contact/billing information. You will receive an email confirming that your order has been received and containing a transaction number as a reference. If you have any questions, please contact Randy Adams, Group Services Manager, PITTSBURGH OPERA[masked] x213 or [masked]

If you want to check out photos of seating views to the stage inside the Benedum at various ticket price points, here is the link https://opera.culturaldistrict.org/performance/44067/tiers/show

As an additional note -- and for those that might be looking to buy the cheapest possible ticket ($13-$21 plus ticket handling charges but with no discount) -- please know that you can do this easily yourself by going online http://www.pittsburghopera.org/show/the-barber-of-seville or call (412)[masked], or stopping buy the Theater Square/Benedum Box Office.  Also, we'll post comments later on to let people know if the cheapest possible tickets will still be available at the door or if the show will approach a sell out.

The Meetup ticket offer is a really good deal, so definitely think about treating yourself or bringing family/friends for a truly memorable evening.

UNDERSTAND EVERY WORD! This opera is sung in Italian with English texts projected above the stage. For this reason, the really good seats have both great views to the stage and the text above the stage. 

For more information about"The Barber of Seville" including song/video samples, photos, cast/artistic team, synopsis, etc. please visit http://www.pittsburghopera.org/show/the-barber-of-seville

For more information about Italian composer Gioachino Rossini, please visit https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gioachino_Rossini

PRE-SHOW DISCUSSION Your ticket also includes a very interesting pre-show discussion (including a colorful study guide) which begins one hour before every performance inside the theater. Thus, we shall plan to meet inside the Benedum at 6 PM (on Tuesday, April 5) for this discussion.

And if you can't make it on Tuesday, April 5 or Friday, April 8 performances with the Meetup ticket offer, please consider attending one of the other performances of "The Barber of Seville"


  Saturday, April 2 at 8 PM

  Tuesday, April 5 at 7 PM

  Friday, April 8 at 7:30 PM

  Sunday, April 10  at 2 PM

Normally priced tickets and ticket availability for all performances may be found at https://opera.culturaldistrict.org/production/8275/list_performances


AFTER-SHOW Cast Q&A Discussion with complimentary tea/coffee When the show ends, please feel free to go downstairs inside the Benedum for complimentary coffee/tea while cast members join us to discuss their experiences in performing " "The Barber of Seville" along with some insight about their training, other performances they've been doing around the world, their fun experiences while visiting Pittsburgh, etc. These cast Q&A discussions are often very funny and engaging. This is also a chance to see these opera stars out of costume and actually being quite down-to-earth in addition to their remarkable talents. These Q&A discussions can last 30-60 minutes including  a chance for photos and autographs if desired. 

Normally priced tickets and ticket availability for all performances may be found at https://opera.culturaldistrict.org/production/8275/list_performances

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.

Don't miss this wonderful experience!

Stay tuned for updates!

results.description:
Register Here


Don't miss this opportunity to learn from an expert all the first-aid supplies you'll need for your next outdoor adventure. We'll start by focusing on the five basic variables to consider when building a first-aid kit: group size, trip length and distance, potential injuries and illnesses, specific medical conditions and your own medical knowledge and skills. Plus, we'll discuss the benefits of assemble-it-yourself first-aid kits vs. pre-assembled kits. You'll also participate in a hands-on, small-group discussion of the contents needed for a first-aid kit based on three different outing scenarios. You'll assess the needs of each kit based on the first three basic variables outlined earlier in the clinic. Afterwards, the whole group will come together to discuss what first-aid materials would be needed for each scenario. Our experts will also briefly explain the purpose for each item in the kit. They also discuss where it should be placed, so it can be quickly located during stressful emergency situations. Please note: This is not a first-aid certification class. Proper first-aid training is very important for knowing what to do in emergency situations. You should only attempt first aid when you feel comfortable giving it.


Thank you for your interest in our free "First Aid Kits Clinic." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!


Learn the skills for a lifetime of adventure:
