results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance because you know you are attending. (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $8.50 - RSVP and pay 50 cents via PayPal and $8 cash at the event if you are pretty sure you are attending (note the 50 cents is non-refundable)

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

results.description:
Bagels & Bytes is technology-related peer learning and networking at its best!

Bring your tech questions, ideas, and issues. Join our fellowship of nonprofit techies (professional and "accidental" are equally welcome) as we brainstorm, share ideas and solutions, and support each other!

Both groups are very supportive and non-judgmental. There is no such thing as a "stupid" question at these meetings - all questions and topics for discussion are welcomed.  

We learn from each other in unexpected ways constantly, regardless of knowledge or skill levels. Hence, you don't have to be an "expert" techie to attend, just curious and interested in nonprofit technology. 

Bagels & Bytes is free to attend, but you must RSVP.

results.description:
The Women's Small Business Association (WSBA) is proud to present our 7th annual Pittsburgh Entrepreneur Conference and Honoring Extraordinary Women Awards Luncheon

This signature event to be held on April 6, 2016 will be our most intensive yet! The PIttsburgh Entrepreneur Conference will focus on the different components that contribute to a successful business. The 2016 event includes a full day of education, networking, service vendor presentations and a series of engaging speakers!

9:00 - 9:50 am: Registration/Networking

10:00 - 10:35 am: Be You Smart First - Positioning Yourself as the Revered Authority - Presented by Mary Lee Gannon, President of Starting Over Now 

10:45 - 11:20 am: The (or your) business Defibrillator: How to Jumpstart Your Sales” presented by Melanie Dawn of Skill Refinery


11:30 - 12:45 pm: Honoring Extraordinary Women Awards Luncheon
We will honor the nominees and winners for the following awards.

- 2014 Best Business Woman of Pittsburgh

- Community Service Award presented by WSBA

- 2014 WSBA Business Woman of the Year

Nominate an Extraordinary Woman today!

12:55 - 1:30 pm: "Give yourself the gift of being your own boss without becoming your worst enemy!" presented by Denise LaRosa,  Founder of Mom Talk With Denise LaRosa, LLC.

As entrepreneurs, we think we have flexible schedules. Most of the time we put in more hours then we need to, with no one telling us to stop! This presentation will provide practical steps and tips to achieve life/work balance.

1:40 - 2:15 pm: Joanna Quinne Smith

2:25 - 3:00 pm: Panel Discussion with Q & A: Finding funding for your business.

This event offers several price points to meet any budget!

$42 - Tickets sold through WSBA hostesses at any WSBA event

$45 - General admission (save $8 off the "at the door" price. Deadline is April 4, 2016)

$50 - At the door price (effective 9pm on April 5, 2016)

WSBA Premier members pay $38! Join us today to get discounts on admission, vendor booths, and sponsorship.

Attend any of our WSBA networking events to buy discounted tickets! This link will provide an up to date listing of our upcoming events.

Upcoming WSBA Networking Events

You can participate in this event several ways!

Speaker Application

Sponsorship

Vendor

Click on the links to get additional information on each opportunity.

We invite you to support our worthy cause by sponsoring this day-long conference crafted to educate, entertain and offer exposure to business men and women in the Pittsburgh area. Our event sponsorship packages are designed to enhance the visibility of your business to a highly targeted and active audience. All sponsorships secured by Feb. 31, 2016 will receive a 10% discount. In addition to financial sponsorships we also offer opportunities for product and in-kind sponsorships.

By participating as a sponsor your organization will benefit from extended exposure through media campaigns and promotional efforts directed toward the WSBA network as well as business owners and professionals throughout the Pittsburgh region.

The WSBA was founded in 2007 and is currently one of the largest small business organizations in the region. The mission of the WSBA is to be a valuable resource to business women by helping and stimulating small and start-up businesses. The goal of the WSBA is to foster women's economic independence by helping them develop skills needed for entrepreneurial success through networking and education.

results.description:
How does a PittsburghTennisLeague Season / League run?
The league advertises the season dates and builds a queue of committed players for the season.

Kickoff Day - April 6th

The start day of the season, players are sent a kickoff email that contains important information about the league, the link where your league standings and players contact information. We guarantee 6 playing partners at your playing level, but have been averaging closer to 15+ partners in most cities.


Your Task - "Flexible Scheduling"
After this kickoff email is sent, it is the player's task to communicate with other players. Players should work with their partners to find an agreeable time and location to play the match. While PittsburghTennisLeague doesn't mandate your playing schedule, it is recommended that players schedule at least one match per week. By request of the players, we started to allow players to play 1 rematch per season. The regular season is all about playing as much as you can. As of Jan. 1st, 2013 we've had 189 players play more than 20 matches in a season.

Where to Play?
Play at your local free tennis courts, tennis parks, condo courts or tennis clubs. The league strongly suggests that players jointly try to pick a tennis court location convenient to both. We provide an extensive list of tennis courts, including # of courts, lighting, hitting walls, etc. We strive to keep this list up-to-date

PittsburghTennisLeague sets up a must play dates to push players out on the courts. The final deadline is the date marking the end of the season, at which point players with 5 wins will qualify for a post-season playoff to determine the league champion.


How to Play?
Players can use three semi-standard playing formats: 2 out of 3 sets, 2 sets with 10 point super tie-breaker or the 10-game pro set (First to 10, used when court time is limited).


Playoffs
Each season concludes with a playoffs where players with anywhere from 3 to 5 season wins qualifies for a single elimination tourney. The champion is awarded based upon the league Prize Pool. Each singles league champion also receives a playing entry into the National Tourney which is already scheduled for Crandon Park Tennis Center in Key Biscayne - Nov. 11-13, 2016.


Join Today!!
Full price is $29.95 to play in a season. BUT the earlier you sign up we typically offer early sign-up discounts. Just go to the Join Page and complete the short form. We'd be happy to find you dedicated tennis playing partners.
results.name: Spring Flex Season

results.description:
Join Ad2 Pittsburgh and the Pittsburgh AdFed for Juice, our monthly happy hour the first Wednesday of every month.


This event is geared towards advertising, marketing and creative professionals. You don't have to be a member of Ad2 or AdFed to attend but you should be an individual who share a passion for their profession and the important role they play in the continued growth of Pittsburgh.

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."

results.description:
Simply told but deeply affecting, in the bestselling tradition of Alice McDermott and Tom Perrotta, this urgent novel unravels the heartrending yet unsentimental tale of a woman who kidnaps a baby in a superstore—and gets away with it for twenty-one years.

Lucy Wakefield is a seemingly ordinary woman who does something extraordinary in a desperate moment: she takes a baby girl from a shopping cart and raises her as her own. It’s a secret she manages to keep for over two decades—from her daughter, the babysitter who helped raise her, family, coworkers, and friends.

When Lucy’s now-grown daughter Mia discovers the devastating truth of her origins, she is overwhelmed by confusion and anger and determines not to speak again to the mother who raised her. She reaches out to her birth mother for a tearful reunion, and Lucy is forced to flee to China to avoid prosecution. What follows is a ripple effect that alters the lives of many and challenges our understanding of the very meaning of motherhood.


Please Bring a Chick Lit/Women's Fiction book (that is out in paperback)!

Not sure what to bring?

Here is the definition of Chick Lit: Chick lit is genre fiction within women's fiction which addresses issues of modern women often humorously and lightheartedly*

Here is the definition of Women's Fiction: a modern novel about a woman on the brink of life change and personal growth. Her journey details emotional reflection and action that transforms her and her relationships with others, and  usually includes a hopeful/upbeat ending with regard to her romantic relationship.

If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,

PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

This event is organized by Mobile Growth Academy. 

Our meetup group is collaborating by promoting this event.

This event is a webinar. You can participate online via your computer or any web-enabled device.

Participation in this event is free.

In order to participate, please register here:

https://mga.samcart.com/referral/Free-Webinar/143147 

(After you register, you will receive info on how to get onto the webinar.)

How do you interact with every single user, on a personal basis, at a scale without going insane? How do you personalize your app experience and marketing messages to every user without hiring an army of marketers.

Without customizing your messages to every single user, at every stage of the growth funnel, you'll never be able to scale, and your marketing will most likely fail and cause your startup to crash.

In this webinar, you will  learn the most important three steps you need to nail down  to transform your business into a marketing machine that instantly turns every new users into long term happy users.

The speaker will cover:

1) The critical three steps for scaling your marketing for free, even if you have no marketing team


2) The #1 reason why most app marketers fail at bringing back existing users and  keep them happy (and what to do instead).. 

3) How to instantly delight new users who just installed your app 

4) A simple hack to exponentially increase your retention rates 

and more!

About the Speaker

Nagi Salloum has 12 years of marketing expertise and is currently the founder and CEO of the Mobile Growth Academy, an online platform that offers mobile startups a step-by-step guide to help them market and grow their apps. 

Prior to that, Nagi was the head of global product marketing for Tango Messenger, a Silicon Valley company that raised over $350M and has 400M users worldwide. Nagi also served as the chief marketing officer at N2V, a leading internet investment group, a regional marketing executive for Google, and as a regional brand manager for Procter and Gamble.

Nagi is also a board member, mentor and advisor to dozens of tech startups in Silicon Valley, Norway, Spain, Portugal, Mexico, UAE, UK, Germany, Egypt, Lebanon and many other countries.

If you have questions about the content of this webinar, please contact Nagi at:

[masked]

results.description:
The Thurs., April 7 Biophilia: Pittsburgh meeting will feature Adam Haritan, foraging instructor and founder of Learn Your Land, who will lead a discussion on “Nature Connection Through Foraged Food and Medicine." For millennia, humans have relied on wild plant and mushroom species to fulfill a variety of purposes, including the creation and production of clothing, shelter, cordage, dyes, tools, fire and poisons.  Perhaps the most important and obvious uses of wild species throughout history, however, have been as food and medicine.  While much of the knowledge involved in the procurement of wild food has been dampened over several generations, it is still important and relevant to the 21st century.

Adam Haritan, foraging instructor and founder of Learn Your Land, will discuss the role wild food foraging plays today in providing the missing critical link connecting humans to their land.  As the number of global environmental transgressions increases and the negative effects on the land become increasingly apparent, more and more people are seeking ways to create positive change.  In order to protect the land, Adam suggests, humans must first connect to the land. This presentation will introduce the concept of foraging for food and medicine as one of the easiest and most effective ways to solidify this lasting connection.  Adam will also discuss the work he is doing with LearnYourLand.com — an online database and community of Pennsylvania's naturalists, nature organizations, state parks, and environmental centers.

Meeting Schedule:  
5:30 – 6 p.m.            Networking and refreshments 
6 – 6:30 p.m.            Presentation 
6:30 – 7:30 p.m.      Discussion

Directions and Parking: 
This meeting will take place in the Center for Sustainable Landscapes (CSL) Classroom which is located on the facility’s first floor. The main Conservatory entrance will be closed, as this meeting takes place after normal hours; to access the CSL, follow Frew Street (located between the Oakland/Schenley Park bridge and the Christopher Columbus statue), which will take you around the Conservatory to the lower campus. Guest parking spaces are available on your left as you approach the CSL.
results.name: Biophilia: Pittsburgh April Meeting: Nature Connection through Foraged Food

results.description:
This is a discussion group EN FRANCAIS for those (intermediate and higher) wishing to perfect their conversational French.

I will bring materials for learning/teaching.  This will include 1 song, but there will also be a chapter from:

• La grammaire à l'oeuvre (John Barson-Stanford) - many consider to be the best grammar/conversation book ever written (I have French friends who use it for review).  John Barson was interested in using science fiction, art and other unusual 'gaming' techniques in perfecting grammar and expression.


• Le français Départ/Arrivée (Rassias - Dartmouth) - another classic text.  Rassias was by nature a theater person, and originator of a unique language learning method - very much "in your face" and physical-response oriented.


I will also focus on practicing authentic French phrases and pronunciation.

I say this, because many Americans have reached a plateau in their language learning - and this is totally normal.  BUT in order to progress to the next level, some heavy lifting is in order. 

Homework (reading, writing, listening) will be assigned, also.

results.description:
This event is hosted by Embody Healing, LLC and presented by Rebekah Gamble, Holistic Practitioner. Here are the details: So many of you are sending me notes of chronic grief lately. I want to share something that is precious to me with you. A few years ago, deep in grief and in prayer, I had a series of meditations come to me, along with a few teachings about valor, courage, and compassion. I want to share these with you, because they have been the singular most powerful thing in my life when coping with the sort of grief you learn to live with.

We will open this event with meeting one another and sharing our stories. You do not have to share anything you do not want to. We will then discuss the differences of valor, courage, and compassion, and how to express these to each other and to ourselves. I will share the meditations with you. We will have time to talk and share experiences, and opportunities to get to the root cause of feelings such as anger, guilt or sadness in order to resolve them, and to work with the love that never dies within each of us. We will use any number and combination of therapeutic techniques to help the group, but this will be entirely dependent on what is needed by the people there. I also will share with you some of the things I have learned working with Horse and Turtle, to provide imagery and metaphors you can draw on later in your own healing work. We will also be discussing water in the body and the emotional self, and how to get water on your side to assist your healing work.

There will be a small space for you to release things you are ready to release. For those of you not quite ready to truly let go, there will be grief stones for you to work with and release whenever you are ready, whether at the event or at another time.

If you are grieving a loved one’s passing, please feel free to bring a photo of them or another personal object that is connected to them with you. We will create a small space for photos of those whom we’ve lost where we will light vigil candles to welcome their memory and spirit into our space. All forms of grief are welcome, and the grief does not need to be connected to death. If there is another personal object that connects you to what you are grieving over, please feel welcome to bring it.

At the end of the event, we will have a moment to thank each other, speak to how we benefited from the event, and share something that gives us hope. By then, we will have the companionship of shared experiences and support, which will enable us to share hope with each other.

I want you to feel safe, accepted, heard, and supported in this event, but above all else, I want you to leave feeling loved and resilient. We are limited in space, and I want to make sure you have the comfortable space you need, so we are limiting this event to seven people. Thus, prepayment is required. The cost of the event is $25. You may paypal a payment to [masked], or simply send me your name and email address and I will send you an invoice that can be paid either by card or by paypal.

Feel free to bring something to write on if taking notes or writing out feelings is helpful for you, and feel free to bring any items of comfort you may want for the meditations such as a pillow or a blanket. I will be playing flute and water music, and I will be diffusing oils that are appropriate. If you have any allergies and are RSVPing, please alert me so I may make an appropriate blend.

Because these are small groups, we are having two to help as many as possible. The same event is on April 7th and April 21st.

Love to you and I hope to see you there.
results.name: Wind and water: Healing chronic grief through compassion, valor, and courage

results.description:
This is a traditional Hatha class taught with a vinyasa flow. We flow from one position to the next and focus on alignment, posture, breath, increased flexibility, strength, and balance. Class is held in the Keith Seminar Center upstairs at Dormont Library. It's private, has dimmer lights, carpet and we play music. I do the practice as I teach it. I tend to break a sweat and others do too, but it depends how much you put into it. The classes are usually 50/50 men and women. Lots of couples - couples, friends, sisters - attend. The class is donation-based. $5 donation is suggested.

All classes are from 7:00 – 8:00 pm. Beginners are welcome.

$5 donation suggested.

Loaner mats available.

Visit: https://www.facebook.com/dormontyoga for more info. Hope to see you soon.
results.name: Yoga at the Library (Dormont, South Hills)

results.description:
In the near future, enormous spaceships suddenly appear over Earth's largest cities. Their owners remain hidden from view, but bring with them an end to war, disease and poverty. A new golden age is clearly at hand. There is, of course, a hidden agenda that will change humanity forever.

Published in 1953, Childhood’s End was Arthur Clarke’s first significant novel and is widely considered to be one of the great classics of early science fiction. It was made into a three-part mini-series that aired on the SciFi Channel in December and is available to watch online. We’ll discuss both the film and the book, but I strongly recommend the book!
results.name: Childhood's End by Arthur C. Clarke

results.description:
The Italian Film Festival April 1-16 is finally here!
7 recent Italian films, all of them Pittsburgh premieres!
All films are FREE and open to the public. Movies are in Italian with English subtitles.

April 16th - Free closing reception with in the Frick Fine Arts Cloisters! For more information: </a><a href="http://www.italianfilmfests.org/pittsburgh.html">http://www.italianfilmfests.org/pittsburgh.html
Italian Program at the University of Pittsburgh's photo.
‪#‎ItalianFilmFestivalPittsburgh‬ ‪#‎mondoitaliano

Plot:Anna, Mauro, Milena and the others do not know each other, but they all have something in common: they left Italy, transferring abroad and betting on the opportunity for a better future.  A future that seemed difficult to imagine remaining in Italy. An entire generation is being drained outside of Italy’s borders. Not only “brainiacs” but also normal youth, citizens split in half, divided between a life with greater possibilities abroad but with the homesickness and frustration that every ex-pat has, even those who left voluntarily. The documentary reports what the young Italians living abroad do, think, dream, whether they will remain or return, and if leaving is really the emergency exit to change their uncertain future. A trip from Vienna to Paris, Tenerife, Bergen, London and New York; six stories of ordinary separation, one theme: that of a forgotten generation that has something to say to their home country.Director:Brunella FilìCast:Bill Emmott, Patrizia Pierazzo, Chiara Capraro, Mauro Gargano, Milena Maselli, Nicola Cataldo, Anna Binetti, Marco Lanza, Camilla Bonetti, Walter Calvaresi, Martina Zipoli, Alessia Gatti, Andrea Lodovichetti, Chiara Bernasconi, Matteo RignaneseYear:2014Length:66 min.Genre:Documentary


‬
results.name: ITALIAN FILM FESTIVAL  - "Emergency Exit" (Italian with English subtitles)

results.description:
The Pittsburgh Change Ringing Guild meets regularly on Thursday nights to practice and hone our change ringing skills.

Non-ringers are welcome to attend Thursday night practices to come check out what we do.  When entering the tower, the most important rule is DO NOT touch the ropes unless specifically instructed to by an experienced bell ringer.  If people are currently ringing the bells when you walk in the room, please come in quietly and have a seat around the edges of the room.  We will stop ringing in a few minutes, and can give you an introduction to the bells.

Non-Ringers can also have an opportunity to try pulling the bell under the guidance of an experienced bell ringer.  We are also more than happy to teach you the ancient art of bell ringing.
Learning to ring the bells does take some time before you would be able to ring comfortably on your own.  Obviously the more effort you put into it the more quickly you would be able to ring confidently on your own.  You can expect 4-6 weeks of individual instruction to get to that stage.  And then once you learn how to handle the bells, that opens up a lifetime of ringing opportunities!

Check out the videos below to see what the bell ringing is like, and you are more than welcome to come join us for our practice night!  Please RSVP if you are coming, because practices sometimes get cancelled for various reasons.

Bells swinging: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=liuRptmR088 
Ringers pulling ropes: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M1vSfNF7OfI
results.how_to_find_us: Enter Southminster church by the doors between the church and the middle school. Either walk to the 4th floor or take the elevator to the 4th floor. Turn left and continue up the stairs to the Bell Tower.
results.name: Change Ringing Practice Night

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."
results.name: Fight Club: Ready ... Set ... Action!

results.description:
Hello everyone!

Another great night of gaming last Friday!  Started the night off with a little Dungeons and Dragons themed dice game called Inn-Fighting.  It was a cute little dice chucker where you are punching and hitting with chairs your opponents characters.  A few more people arrived and we split up into a couple of groups to play Kemet (1st play and a fantastic game experience) and another game which I can't remember the name and finally that group finished up with Shadows of Camelot.   

I will be bringing out some of my recent favorites like:  Mombassa, Bruges, Five Tribes, Kemet, and Above and Below.

If any of those games interest you please let me know down in the chat and I will save you a seat at the table.  


Looking forward to Friday night, hope to see you there!


Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play...


Party games like:  Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like:  Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico, Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like:  Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like:  Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you soon!

Russ.

Soldiers & Sailors Museum Comes Alive:

Cocktails & Camaraderie Over 21 Night!

at Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Museum in Oakland, 6pm to 8pm!

Museum Comes Alive: Cocktails & Camaraderie Over 21 Night

$5 Admission at the door.

MUST BE AT LEAST 21 TO ENTER!

Full service cash bar available

Join us for a rare opportunity to experience the sights, sounds and sips of the ages as we take you back in time through American history at our first ever Museum Comes Alive happy hour event: Cocktails & Camaraderie!

• Four vintage cocktails that were popular in the mid-century but probably haven’t been served for decades!

• Listen to the traditional music from the Civil War, WWII, Korean, and Vietnam War eras!

• Selected exhibits from the Civil War, WWII, Korea, and Vietnam will be brought to life in interactive settings …Visit our M.A.S.H. tent!

• View exclusive authentic artifacts from the Civil, WWI, WWII, Korea, Vietnam, and current conflicts displayed for this night only!

Complimentary appetizers stationed throughout the museum

Docents available throughout the museum to elaborate on the various exhibits

Veteran owned Shubrew Brewery will also be onsite for the craft beer enthusiast!

#MUSEUMCOMESALIVE

#SOLDIERSANDSAILORSHALL

PARKING: There is a parking garage UNDERNEATH Soldiers and Sailors Memorial

Come - let us learn how to play mah jong or seriously play mah jong and have some fun.  Please post that you are a beginner if you need instructions.  I suggest beginners try to get there by 6 pm to allow time to learn and then have a game or two after that. But come whenever you can.

If you plan to eat, try to come earlier or finish your food before you sit in for a game. I found out that mah jong is not a good game to be eating and playing at the same time. Since we are using the facilities of Panera, no outside food or drinks please.  Also please purchase a drink or snack or food to support them for allowing us to use their facilities.


Another group has already reserved the Community Room, so the manager said we could use the bigger round tables outside the Room. It will still be in the back area of the restaurant.


This Panera is on the ground floor of the Quality Inn Hotel. It also has a free parking lot and is on exit 376 to Bates Street to Blvd of the Allies. So it is not right into the narrow, crowded streets of Oakland.

Yuet and Denetta will be hosting.

results.description:
Experience the classic Italian opera "The Barber of Seville" by Gioachino Rossini which has thrilled audiences since its premiere in 1816 in Rome, Italy. "The Barber of Seville" has proven to be one of the greatest masterpieces of comedy within music, and has been described as the opera buffa of all "opere buffe". Even after two hundred years, it remains an extremely popular work that is frequently performed and appears 8th on the Operabase list of the most-performed operas worldwide.


Rossini’s madcap comedy is guaranteed to send you out laughing and humming a tune.


Count Almaviva is in love with the beautiful Rosina. Rosina is essentially being held captive by the slimy Bartolo, who wants to marry her himself. With the help of the barber Figaro, Almaviva and Rosina attempt to outwit Bartolo and live happily ever after.


While the original popular romantic comedy was based on an 18th-century play set in Seville, Spain, the new look for Pittsburgh Opera's production will update the story by staging it in the Hollywood era around 1950.

THE BARBER OF SEVILLE is the perfect introductory opera. It features recognizable music, comedic staging, fun costumes and a happy ending.

But THE BARBER OF SEVILLE will be LARGER THAN LIFE because of the amazing ensemble cast - which includes two former Resident Artists with tremendous personalities, Kevin Glavin and Jonathan Beyer - and the Pittsburgh debut of Michele Angelini, who has received superlative reviews around the world in his role. Antony Walker conducts.


Please note that this production will be sung in the original Italian with projected English titles.

Check out these great articles and reviews of this production http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music/2016/04/03/Review-Pittsburgh-Opera-gives-classic-Barber-of-Seville-a-Hollywood-makeover/stories/201604030259


http://triblive.com/aande/music/10227567-74/barber-opera-pittsburgh

http://www.pghintheround.com/the-barber-of-seville/

http://www.nextpittsburgh.com/events/pittsburgh-opera-present-a-fresh-new-take-on-the-barber-of-seville/

http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music/2016/03/30/Opera-Preview-Pittsburgh-Opera-s-Barber-of-Seville-opens-with-one-of-opera-s-most-famous-arias/stories/201603310039

http://www.pittsburghmagazine.com/Best-of-the-Burgh-Blogs/The-412/March-2016/For-Pittsburgh-Native-Opera-is-a-Laughing-Matter/

http://triblive.com/aande/moreaande/10122474-74/opera-barber-rosina

To check out example videos of this Pittsburgh Opera production (so you can get a feel for the music, actors, costumes, scenes, set design, etc. but without the english translations), please visit http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwopera/videoplay.cfm?colid=1294390#

Check out these example videos of several scenes from other productions of"The Barber of Seville" where some english translations are also included

https://youtu.be/TCUNvCjLrTo?list=PL3yrlvmdaUwjzVUg6Eo2HDOdM-U-_uLjF&t=11

https://youtu.be/7qHZkkgowdY?t=119


Meetup Ticket Discount Offer

Pittsburgh Opera is very graciously offering the Meetup a fantastic deal for great seats for a wonderful experience with powerful music and stunning set/costumes.

And for even more flexibility, Pittsburgh Opera is offering the discount for two performance dates (so we'll be scheduling Meetup dates for each one) 

  Tuesday, April 5 at 7 PM 

  Friday, April 8 at 7:30 PM

Meetup members can purchase tickets to either performance for the following special prices:

$50 for best available in Sections A & B (regularly $102.75 to $157.75 in value) which are equivalent to the best seats on the Orchestra Floor or Directors Circle with fantastic views to the stage.

$30 for best available in Sections C & D (regularly $42.75 to $79.75) which are equivalent to really good seats on the Orchestra Floor or First Tier/lower Second Tier in the balcony with great views to the stage.

This is a very generous offer and a wonderful opportunity to experience opera, especially for those that perhaps have never checked out classic opera before.  Naturally, this offer is not intended to be a substitute for Pittsburgh Opera[masked] subscriptions which also have many benefits.

If you prefer going on Tuesday, April 5 instead, please RSVP to other Meetup posting http://www.meetup.com/Art-lovers/events/229595945/

With this special Meetup offer, please note that you will be seated on the day of the show with the best available seating in your selected sections. Pick up your tickets at the Benedum Center Box Office Will Call starting 2 hours before your performance.  To take advantage of this special Meetup offer, please go online https://pct.formstack.com/forms/operaforms_op16_meet_up_offer_the_barber_of_seville Just click "Continue" below and follow the steps to place your order. Confirm your seating selection, then select the number of seats, and provide your contact/billing information. You will receive an email confirming that your order has been received and containing a transaction number as a reference. If you have any questions, please contact Randy Adams, Group Services Manager, PITTSBURGH OPERA[masked] x213 or [masked]

If you want to check out photos of seating views to the stage inside the Benedum at various ticket price points, here is the link https://opera.culturaldistrict.org/performance/44067/tiers/show

As an additional note -- and for those that might be looking to buy the cheapest possible ticket ($13-$21 plus ticket handling charges but with no discount) -- please know that you can do this easily yourself by going online http://www.pittsburghopera.org/show/the-barber-of-seville or call (412)[masked], or stopping buy the Theater Square/Benedum Box Office.  Also, we'll post comments later on to let people know if the cheapest possible tickets will still be available at the door or if the show will approach a sell out.

The Meetup ticket offer is a really good deal, so definitely think about treating yourself or bringing family/friends for a truly memorable evening.

UNDERSTAND EVERY WORD! This opera is sung in Italian with English texts projected above the stage. For this reason, the really good seats have both great views to the stage and the text above the stage. 

For more information about"The Barber of Seville" including song/video samples, photos, cast/artistic team, synopsis, etc. please visit http://www.pittsburghopera.org/show/the-barber-of-seville

For more information about Italian composer Gioachino Rossini, please visit https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gioachino_Rossini

PRE-SHOW DISCUSSION Your ticket also includes a very interesting pre-show discussion (including a colorful study guide) which begins one hour before every performance inside the theater. Thus, we shall plan to meet inside the Benedum at 6 PM (on Tuesday, April 5) for this discussion.

And if you can't make it on Tuesday, April 5 or Friday, April 8 performances with the Meetup ticket offer, please consider attending one of the other performances of "The Barber of Seville"


  Saturday, April 2 at 8 PM

  Tuesday, April 5 at 7 PM

  Friday, April 8 at 7:30 PM

  Sunday, April 10  at 2 PM

Normally priced tickets and ticket availability for all performances may be found at https://opera.culturaldistrict.org/production/8275/list_performances

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.

Don't miss this wonderful experience!

Stay tuned for updates!

venue.name: Carrie Furnaces - Rivers of Steel National Heritage Area

results.description:
Many photographers in the Detroit area have spent much time photographing in and around the various auto plants and factories from days gone by. Travel with us to the city that produced much of the steel that was used in those factories, Pittsburgh. We will visit the Carrie Furnaces that were part of the Homestead Mill complex. In addition, Pittsburgh is one of the country's hidden gems with great photo ops.  We can capture the beauty of 3 rivers, bridges, skyscrapers, rolling hills,inclines,etc.

View a video shot in and around the Carrie Furnaces. https://youtu.be/0QxjiZVpr30


This trip will have a minimum of 6 , line up your fellow photographers.

Our schedule:

Plan to in Pittsburgh Friday evening. We will get together at the hotel to handout directions and other information. For those interested , we can head out for some shooting in the downtown area at night.

Plan to be up and ready to leave the hotel by 8:30 am and we will head to the Homestead Mill complex for our time at the Carrie Furnaces. About 30 minutes drive.


Around 1:00 pm , head back towards the city, stopping for lunch in the area.  From there , we will spend the afternoon at various locations in and around Pittsburgh . Various buildings or the Pittsburgh Botanical Garden.

At 5:00 , its back to the hotel for a chance to freshen up and charge batteries a bit. Off to dinner at one of the many choices within walking distance from our hotel.

After dinner we will load up and head up to the overlooks of the city on Mount Washington for fantastic shots of the city as the sun goes down and lights come on.

 Next morning after breakfast, at the hotel, it’s off for more shooting. Some of the area(s) we might visit are Mount Washington overlooking the city, wander the downtown area to photograph the architecture bridges that cross the rivers, or head to one of the two remaining inclined railways that travel up the hill from the river. You can head home or hang out from here.

Pittsburgh is about a 4 ½ to 5  easy drive . We will try to  coordinate carpooling from Michigan if needed.

The fee at the Rivers of Steel Heritage Park ( Steel Mil) is included , transportation, lodging, admission fee’s other than the steel park and meals are not.

$[masked] per person.

This trip will have a minimum of 6 , line up your fellow photographers.


After registration , we will provide you with driving directions to our gathering location and Liability waivers that will be required to be signed before we enter the area. Recommended equipment list will also be included.

Lodging Information


A group room rate has been set up at the Sheraton Pittsburgh Hotel at Station Square

Your special group rate is $129.00, subject to tax, which is currently 14%.  Your rates are for our standard king or double/double guestrooms based on single or double occupancy.  Each additional person will be $20.00 extra.  Room types will be on a request basis only, and hotel is unable to guarantee specific room types.  Additional charges, such as parking charges, may apply

All reservations must be made by March 25th 2016 in order to receive the discounted rate and the discounted rate will not apply to rooms beyond those noted above.  To make reservations, your guests must phone in their reservation requests, to the following number: [masked]-3535.

It is important that each of your guests identify themselves as part of your group,  Creative Vision Photography Workshop and provide us with guest name, requested type of room, requested bed type (i.e. king, double/double or suites), and check-in and check-out dates. Any requests for special room arrangements must be made at the time of this call.

PARKING Current parking rate is $23.00 per vehicle per 24-hour period with in and out privileges, and is subject to change without notice or $21.00 per vehicle per 24-hour period without in and out privileges.

When reservations are made, we will require a deposit equal to the room rate and tax for the first night for each reservation.  An individual’s deposit is refundable to that individual if the Hotel receives notice of an individual’s cancellation at least 24 hours prior to scheduled arrival.


Please contact me if you have any questions about this or the trip.

results.description: All riders are welcome at our Saturday morning Beginner Ride. The average pace of this ride is 8-12 miles per hour. In other words, nice-n-easy. J The ride starts and ends at our Pittsburgh Performance Bicycle store and lasts approximately one hour. The beginner route includes residential riding and local bike paths, as well as 1 moderately busy, yet approachable intersection that we’ll tackle as a group. The Beginner Ride provides an opportunity to build basic riding skills including: ride with others in a group, ride safely and confidently when vehicles are present, bring the right gear on your ride, shift and brake comfortably and effectively. More experienced riders can attend the Beginner Ride to meet new people and share knowledge with those new to cycling. Rides are weekly, rain or shine. (Thunder cancels.)

results.description:
Bhangra is a high-spirited, north Indian folk dance and has become immensely popular worldwide. American Bellydance often combines Middle Eastern dance with other popular world dance moves. Learning Bhangra and Bellydance together is a perfect mutli-cultural activity, while working out your entire body. There is no doubt you will be sweating bullets by the end of this workshop but don't worry, you will be getting a 15 min break! : )

Students of all levels are welcome, no experience necessary. Please wear comfortable, loose clothing and no socks and shoes. Feel free to bring a notebook to take notes.

Dance teachers:
Anjali Soi: www.asoiflamencodance.com
Amethyst: www.pittsburghbellydance.com

Fee: $90

To secure your spot, please send payments via paypal to [masked] by April 7th. After that, only cash at the door. Thank you!

results.description:

results.description:
Free Family-Friendly Brown Bag Concert

You're invited to a free Brown Bag concert as Pittsburgh Opera's Resident Artists serenade you in a special program highlighting Opera in English.


 April 9, 2016
  12:00 PM - 1:00 PM

Location: 2425 Liberty Avenue, in the Strip District

Free and open to the public, these monthly one-hour concerts feature Pittsburgh Opera Resident Artists in the George R. White Opera Studio at Pittsburgh Opera  Headquarters. Bring a friend and bring your lunch!  There is usually complimentary coffee, tea, and cookies.

The concert program will feature famous operas performed in English, including a sneak peak of the upcoming Pittsburgh Opera production "The Rake's Progress" (which will be performed in English) during April 30 - May 8, 2016 at the Benedum Center.

Doors open at 11:30 AM.  Please note that the Pittsburgh Opera  garage is available only for handicapped parking, by reservation. RESERVATIONS MUST BE RECEIVED BY 4:00 PM FRIDAY, April 8.

For more information about this Brown Bag Concert, please visit http://www.pittsburghopera.org/calendar/detail/april-brown-bag-concert

For more information (including videos) about the upcoming Pittsburgh Opera production of "The Rake's Progress"  (by Igor Stravinsky) which will be performed during April 30 - May 8, 2016 at the Benedum Center, please visit http://pittsburghopera.org/show/the-rakes-progress

For more information about Pittsburgh Opera and the complete line-up for the[masked] season, please visit http://pittsburghopera.org

So whether you're curious or just looking to take a little break while shopping in the Strip, please consider stopping by Pittsburgh Opera to enjoy their resident artists as they sing classics to give guests a little taste of opera.

And if you're relatively new to Meetup, this would be a nice event to attend to meet lots of people in a very relaxed, convenient setting.  Because the concert ends at 1 PM, your Saturday afternoon will still be open. Depending on the RSVPs and interests of the group, some people may decide to go out for an optional lunch or just walk around the Strip District checking out some places. 

Because we're expecting a large group, we'll also discuss various options for those that wish to continue their afternoon in the Strip District. For example, we may have 5-30+ Meetup members that might like to check out a few more things (say from 1:30- 5 PM) with the group.

Options for Spending Time in the Strip District After the Concert

In addition to many interesting restaurants, shops, bars, etc.,  there are some other great places within a short walk of the Pittsburgh Opera location, such as the Heinz History Center & Western Pennsylvania Sports Museum (1212 Smallman Street) http://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/ which features the new Toys of the ’50s, ’60s and ’70s Exhibit  (March 4, 2016 – May 31, 2016) http://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/exhibits/toys-50s-60s-70s Here is the visitor guide (to all 7 floors of incredible galleries) http://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/History-Center-Visitor-Guide-2015-April.pdf Admission is Adults ($16); Senior Citizens 62+ ($14); Retired & Active Duty Military ($6.50); Students with a valid school ID ($6.50); Children ages 6-17 ($6.50); Children ages 5 and under (Free)

Another option would be to check out the fascinating "Silver to Steel" exhibit which will be closing on April 11 at the Carnegie Museum of Art. Check out these great reviews http://triblive.com/aande/museums/9466456-74/muller-munk-peter

http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/art-architecture/2016/01/10/Peter-Muller-Munk-gave-Mad-Men-their-style/stories/201601050220

http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/the-carnegies-retrospective-on-silversmith-and-product-designer-peter-muller-munk-is-thoroughly-satisfying/Content?oid=1883965

If you haven't seen this "Silver to Steel" exhibit, it is definitely worth a trip. With this option, people could drive over to the museum for the rest of the afternoon.  And perhaps they could get some lunch (inside the museum) or dinner at a nearby restaurant.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in lobby at 11:30-11:45 AM before the noon performance. These concerts draw big crowds, so it is best to get there early. We will also gather in the lobby following the show for more coffee/tea, cookies, and discussions with the artists.
results.name: Free Brown Bag Concert -- Opera in English

results.description:
This is part of LFG's classes series. We'll be doing a mix of classes with a cost and talks that are free. For this specific class, you will also have to get a ticket on eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/chiptunes-a-how-to-workshop-for-making-digital-and-analog-noise-tickets-21642896486

In this workshop, Jarek Lupinski will be shortly going over the Chip Maestro and the story of its development, before diving into the technical details behind how it actually coaxes the familiar notes you expect to hear from an NES. This ties into the second part of the workshop, where he will walk you through actually building a real portable electronic instrument that you can take home and play anywhere, anytime!

Every attendee will receive a kit of electronics components (yours to keep!) that we will assemble together to recreate the popular Atari Punk Console circuit. No tools or experience is necessary! This workshop is a great way for beginners to jump into the world of electronics and electronic music, while offering veterans some design tips and insights into what actually happens when your prototype hits the shelves.

The entire workshop should take around two hours, with an extra hour at the end to hang out and help with projects and explore ways to improve your circuit. If there is a large attendance, more time may be required so that everybody can get enough hand-on
results.name: Chiptunes: A How-To and Building Class

results.description:
Have you always wanted to know how to play Dungeons & Dragons (D&D)? I'm willing to teach you.

We are going to meet Saturday afternoon 2pm-5(or 6pm) April 9th at Gamemasters 3439 Babcock Boulevard in the North Hills to meet and greet, form characters (optional), and play. 

$2 will be charged per person to help cover the space. If you need help with a ride from the city, let me know. I have up to 2 spots open for those who are serious in learning and playing. It there are more players interested, I will start a waiting list. I prefer finding people who can commit to meeting bi-weekly Saturday afternoons.


 If it's been a long time since you played or are a new player to the game, you are welcome too. I'm happy to teach you if you are new to the game. We will be playing 1st edition Basic D&D for clarity and simplicity. The adventures will be in the form of prepublished modules and selections from Dungeon Magazine. I have the materials for everyone. If you would like, bring some spare sheets and a writing utensil.

About D&D:

Your characters star in the adventures you play, just like the heroes of a book or movie. Your character has unique strengths, weaknesses, and abilities. They might be a savage barbarian from the frozen wastes, or a clever rogue with a quick wit and a quicker blade. Your character might be an archer trained in wilderness survival techniques, or a wizard who has mastered the arcane arts of casting powerful magics.

Each player will decide the actions for, and portray the role of their specific character, embarking upon an imaginary adventure. Along the way, the results of the chosen actions of the characters within the story will determine the overall plot, similar to that of a work of fiction.

The characters will form a group that interacts with the setting's inhabitants (and each other). Together they will solve dilemmas, test their skills, and engage in battles and gather treasure and knowledge.

The Game referee is the Dungeon Master (DM). The DM controls the monsters and enemies, narrates the action, referees the game, and sets up the adventure. Together, the Dungeon Master and the players make the game come alive.
results.how_to_find_us: see you at Gamemasters!
results.name: Introduction to Dungeons and Dragons (D&D) and PLAYING D&D!

Take your yoga practice outdoors...no mats required! Our Outdoor Discovery School instructors will guide you on a rejuvenating 3 to 4 mile hike on the South Ridge of North Park. During the hike, we'll break occasionally to take a few standing poses and tension tamers, led by experienced yoga instructor, Jen. Our yoga hike will conclude with a seated guided relaxation.

This outing is suitable for those new to yoga, and is designed for all levels of fitness, so come join us for an energizing experience you won't want to miss.

NOTE: There are some discrepancies between the L.L.Bean.com calendar and this Meetup post. Please refer to this Meetup's description above. Yoga will be practiced along the hike and mats are not needed.

Thank you for your interest in our free "Yoga Hike." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!


Activity Level: 
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy 
Level of Experience: Intro

Hiking Boots or Trail Shoes 
Day Pack 
Water to stay hydrated 
Snacks 
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement--> Click Here

Optional: Optics, Lip Balm, Camera, Walking Stick or Trekking Poles, Personal Medicines

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors. 

Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

results.description:
Let's meetup at Buffalo Wild Wings in West Mifflin, then proceed to the Observatory! It would be wise to carpool there during daylight hours because the observatory can be difficult to find. Perhaps we could leave some cars at BDub's, and perhaps it would be a good idea to bring some lawnchairs and frisbees to keep us occupied during the daylight hours at the observatory.

If you would like to keep this leaning closer to the "free" part of this meetup and skip dinner, feel free to meetup with us and carpool at BDub's parking lot after dinner. We will likely depart to the Observatory at 6pm.

Observatory telescopes and ameteur telescopes will be there, and the owners are usually VERY nice about inviting strangers to use their scopes.

I don't yet know what stars will be visible that night. The websites have not been updated yet. If anybody knows how to look this up, that would be fantastic! http://wp.3ap.org/calendar/

http://wp.3ap.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Wagman_Sched_2016.pdf

Mobile phone GPS does not work very well in the park. But there is a function that can save the map prior to arrival, and then the GPS works very well. I have never used this function, but I have researched it and it looks easy. There are tutorials online for how to use mobile GPS where there is no service. Good luck with that. :-)

The Star Party is, of course, a weather dependent event. If the weather doesn't cooperate, perhaps we can schedule an indoor event after dinner. Movie, perhaps?

See you there!
results.name: (Cancelled) Dinner, then Star Party at Mingo Creek Park Observatory

results.description:
This show runs NOW THROUGH APRIL 10th. If you attend, please RSVP and post your photos here. Watch timeless artworks come to life through intricate displays of bright blooms.

A celebration of renewal and regrowth, our annual Spring Flower Show is the perfect reward for the senses, and this year’s theme, “Masterpieces in Bloom,” will treat you to the works of Van Gogh, Monet and countless other famous artists through breathtaking botanical renderings.

A beautiful spring day gets even more gorgeous with a journey through our vibrant display rooms. The Palm Court will invite you to step through a larger-than-life picture frame and into the world of Edmund Leighton’s “Lady in a Garden” with its pink and red snapdragons and white orchids; the Serpentine Room will surround you in swirls of delphiniums, forget-me-nots and primula to recreate the sky of Van Gogh’s “Starry Night”; the East Room will present “Tulip Field in Holland” by Claude Monet with a windmill and beds filled with hundreds of red, orange, yellow and white tulips; and plenty of other art-inspired surprises will delight around every corner. Spend a spring day or night at “Masterpieces in Bloom” enjoying this one-of-a-kind opportunity to watch nature and art come together.


Spring Flower Show, designed by Hays Landscape Architecture Studio, Ltd., runs through April 10. Hours are 9:30 a.m. – 5 p.m. daily and until 10 p.m. on Fridays. Admission is $15 for adults, $14 for seniors and students, and $11 for children (2 – 18). Members and kids under 2 enter free.

results.description:
We will be Mass Mobbing our way to the gorgeous St. Peter's Catholic Church in Pittsburgh which has a history going all the way back to 1850! Andrew Peebles was hired by the Pittsburgh diocese to be the architect for this beautiful church. It's present cornerstone dates back to 1871. Due to the slow construction of St. Peter's, the basement was blessed on December 1, 1872 and used to conduct Masses until the church was finished.


For over one hundred years now, this beautiful church has been a beacon of hope, Pittsburgh history and Faith. Experience it now for yourself! St. Peter's has been undergoing a major renovation including their breathtaking stained glass windows. This is a Pittsburgh Mass Mob that you don't want to miss. Discover the beauty of downtown Pittsburgh all over again!

God bless, and Happy Mass Mobbing!

Elizabeth and your Pittsburgh Mass Mob team
results.name: Pittsburgh Mass Mob at St. Peters in Pittsburgh April 10 at 10:30 AM!

results.description:
This event is ALMOST free: there is a $6 fee for the map, and a group/family can do the event together with the one purchased map. For example, if two people do the event together with one map, it comes to $3/person.

There is no precise start time, as anyone can register and start on their own anytime between 10:45 AM and 2 PM. The event closes at 3:30 PM. Not a mass start event, but staggered starts whenever people feel like hiking out.

Orienteering is an outdoor activity in which participants find flags in the woods using a specially-designed topographic map. It is an activity that merges both physical and mental activities. There will be courses for beginners, intermediate, advanced. Fee per map is $6. Family/group can do event together with a single purchased map if they wish. Not a mass start, but staggered starts, anytime between 11 AM and 2 PM. Courses close at 3:30, time when volunteers begin the tear-down of the courses. Participants can do more than one course if they wish: for example start with a beginner and then try an intermediate. Course length varies from 2 to 7 km. Bring clothing and footwear for the outdoors. Event happens regardless of weather, rain or shine.

Meet start is at shelter #5. Look for white-and-red arrow-shaped signs at nearby intersections. Details at www.wpoc.org

---

the first regular WPOC sponsored orienteering event of 2016 at Mingo Creek Park on April 10. There will be a variety of courses for you to try: a 2.3 km beginner (white), a 3.6 km novice (yellow), a 4.4 km intermediate (orange), a 3.5 km short advanced (brown) and a 6.7 km advanced long (red). The courses will offer good opportunities to avoid the thick vegetation that covers parts of the park.
As usual, registration and starts are from 11 am to 2 pm. Member map fee is $5 (all others is $6). Driving directions are below. For more information, go to www.wpoc.org
Don't forget, if you are bringing a minor who is not your son or daughter, you need to bring a waiver signed by the minor's parent (obtainable under Club Documents at www.wpoc.org ).
I hope many of you will venture to Washington Co. and join the fun.
Jim
---------------There are many ways to reach Mingo Creek Park. The preferred ways involve using Sichi Hill Rd, Chapel Hill Rd (best choice), or Mansion Hill Rd from PA route 136 and coming into the park from the south to reach Mingo Creek Rd. Note: Mansion Hill Rd ends by crossing a covered bridge; Chapel Hill Rd ends by crossing a regular bridge; and from Sichi Hill Rd you need to bear right onto Sugar Run Rd briefly and then turn right into the park. The event is at shelter #5 about half way between where Chapel Hill Rd and Sichi Hill Rd reach Mingo Creek Rd. There are signs giving directions to each shelter in the park. There will also be red and white orienteering signs showing the way from the Mingo Creek Rd/Chapel Hill Rd intersection.Here are some suggested approaches to route 136.From Pittsburgh, go south on PA route 51 or PA route 88 or US route 19. On route 51, go south past Jefferson Hills to the end of Turnpike 43 (exit 54), enter theTurnpike and go south to exit 44 (route 136). Follow 136 west past Ginger Hill to one of the three streets mentioned above; turn right and enter the park. There is a toll for using Turnpike 43. On route 88, go south past Bethel Park and Finleyville until you cross under Turnpike 43, then bear right onto Gearing Rd. After about 0.5 miles, turn right onto route 136. Follow 136 west past Ginger Hill to one of the three streets mentioned above; turn right and enter the park. The map shows another possible route using Venetia Rd, Sugar Run Rd, and Park View Rd from Finleyville. On route 19, go south past Upper St. Clair and Murry Hill to route 519. Turn left on route 519 and follow it 6 miles south to the town of Eighty Four and route 136. Follow 136 east to one of the three streets mentioned above, turn left and enter the park.From the northwest, follow I-79 south past Canonsburg to exit 43. There, take route 519 south 7 miles to the town of Eighty Four and route 136. Follow 136 east to one of the three streets mentioned above, turn left and enter the park.From the west, follow I-70 east to esit 25. There, take route 519 north 2 miles to the town of Eighty Four and route 136. Follow 136 east to one of the three streets mentioned above, turn left and enter the park.From the east, follow I-70 to exit 32A (route 917), follow that five miles north to route 136. Follow 136 west past Ginger Hill to one of the three streets mentioned above; turn right and enter the park. You can save about 5 minutes (at the cost of $0.70) by taking exit 37 from I-70 and following Turnpike 43 north nine miles to exit 44.
results.name: map and compass hiking at Mingo Creek park

results.description:
This weekend the Rust Belt Coalition of Young Preservationists (RBCoYP) are descending on Pittsburgh for a weekend of preservation learning.
One Sunday morning they will be touring Carrie Furnace in Braddock. Tickets are $15 and are still tickets available for this event.
You must buy a ticket here: http://bit.ly/1N9wEWk

Details of tour:
Constructed in 1906, the Carrie Furnaces stood at the heart of U.S. Steel's Homestead Works until 1979. At one time, the furnaces and the steelworkers who labored in them produced more than 1,000 tons of iron a day. Now these 92-foot-tall structures stand as sentinels to Pittsburgh's steel heritage. On this tour, a Rivers of Steel tour guide will lead visitors through the iron-making process, sharing the story of the site's technology, workers, and culture from it's heyday to the post-industrial present.

Read more about the RBCoYP event here: http://bit.ly/rbcoyp
results.name: Tour of Carrie Furnace with the Rust Belt Coalition of Young Preservationists

Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

Bi-monthly dinners (and brunches) bring together GlobalPittsburgh members and potential members. If you are not yet a member of GlobalPittsburgh but would like to share a meal and friendly conversation with our group, you are invited to join us once. To participate in our future events, we will expect you to join GlobalPittsburgh as a member at www.globalpittsburgh.org/membership so that you don’t miss any of our fun activities!

You can RSVP two weeks prior to the event. The RSVP will be closed until then.

If you RSVP "yes", you are expected to show up. Please consider this request seriously. Every guest is looking forward to meeting you if they see your positive RSVP.

If you cancel your reservation later than 2 days prior to the gathering, you will be counted as a "no show". After 3 "no shows" we will, unfortunately, have to remove you from the group. It is all about respect to the other members and the restaurant staff who make our group dinners happen!

Our mission is to connect the Pittsburgh community with the people here from other countries through year-round activities and networking events.

results.description:
We will be Mass Mobbing our way to the gorgeous St. Peter's Catholic Church in Pittsburgh which has a history going all the way back to 1850! Andrew Peebles was hired by the Pittsburgh diocese to be the architect for this beautiful church. It's present cornerstone dates back to 1871. Due to the slow construction of St. Peter's, the basement was blessed on December 1, 1872 and used to conduct Masses until the church was finished.

For over one hundred years now, this beautiful church has been a beacon of hope, Pittsburgh history and Faith. Experience it now for yourself! St. Peter's has been undergoing a major renovation including their breathtaking stained glass windows. This is a Pittsburgh Mass Mob that you don't want to miss. Discover the beauty of downtown Pittsburgh all over again!

God bless, and Happy Mass Mobbing!

Elizabeth and your Pittsburgh Mass Mob team
results.name: Pittsburgh Mass Mob at St. Peters in Pittsburgh April 10 at 10:30 AM!

results.description:
The Cost to attend? $0.00 BUT we do ask that you help us attract the most diverse (industry and background) set of entrepreneurs and create the most inclusive environment - this means inviting and bringing people, not just attending and participating.  


You can help us spread the word on Twitter or on Instagram or anywhere you can publish www.UnstuckPittsburgh.com using #UnstuckPgh 

Guidelines for the meet up:


1) Be on time, when you come in late (after 7:55AM) then you cause a disruption for everyone who got there on time.  Parents get a pass if they had to send someone off to school but otherwise please make best efforts to be early (help set up), get coffee, use the restroom, etc before we start.

2) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

3) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St.

results.description:
Entrepreneurs helping each other. Bring your ideas, questions and experiences. Providing face-to-face help and feedback for your business in bite-sized chunks.

This meetup is right after the Unstuck Entrepreneur Meetup http://www.meetup.com/unstuckmondaymeetup/ which is right there at Repair the World from 8-9AM. Think about coming to BOTH!


After meeting outside in the lobby of Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn upstairs to Alpha Lab Gear.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. He now keeps busy mentoring for a nationally recognized accelerator, reviewing business plans/pitches for investors and consulting for businesses & non-profits. When asked “why do a meetup?” he says he is looking to “pay it forward” by helping people make less mistakes than he made.
results.name: Entrepreneur Monday Morning Roundtable - Entrepreneurs Helping Each Other

results.description:
To facilitate meaningful conversations as a single group, this MeetUp is limited to 10 participants. The charge for the MeetUp will be left as a group tip to the server. We will display an 8.5" x 11.0" sign to help you find the activity. You can see a copy of the sign in the "General Pictures" Photo Album.

INTRODUCTIONS


We will have a round of introductions during each meeting. This will give you the opportunity to present yourself, your company, and your product or service to everyone else in the room. You should bring at least 15 business cards to hand out to the group as you make your introduction. Please be courteous and respectful of everyone's interest level and time -- KEEP YOUR INTRODUCTION TO 60 SECONDS OR LESS! We don't have to vacate the room immediately after the activity; if anyone is interested in learning more about your product or service, they can have a longer conversation with you right after the activity.

GUEST SPEAKER


We will have a different guest speaker every month. You can find the guest speaker that will be joining us in any particular month by looking at "Guest Speakers" under the "Discussion" tab.

WALK IN POLICY


We want to encourage attendees to RSVP for the meetings, and discourage walk-ins without an RSVP. The RSVPs help us with the planning and coordination of the meetings. Walk-ins without an RSVP will be charged $20. This fee is in addition to and separate from the cost of the lunch. The reason for this charge is to be fair with the participants that took the time and effort to RSVP. Individuals that walk in without an RSVP may have to sit at a side table separate from the main table that is reserved for participants with an RSVP. As a reminder, we want to keep the meeting limited to a small group of participants so we can have a single meaningful conversation, instead of various fragmented and superficial conversations.
results.name: Networking Lunch

group.name: Network of Business Owners and Related Professionals

results.description:
This presentation will take a close look at a requirements method called User Stories, which has become closely associated with Agile projects. Come and see how User Stories are done and how they are different than other requirements techniques.

Abstract

What are User Stories? How are they related to requirements and especially requirements on an Agile project? Are they the same thing as Use Cases? Where am I and what year is it? These are all questions that routinely plague BAs, so come and get some answers!

In this presentation we will look at User Stories to see how they work as a requirements tool, how they compare to other requirements techniques, and how they fit into the Agile world. We will see their structure, the best way to work with them, and how to estimate and prioritize them inside an Agile framework.

Presentation Breakdown

• Agile Requirements

• How are they different?

• Where do they fit into an SDLC?

• What are User Stories?

• Definition

• Structure

•The Three C’s

• Nature of User Stories

• Writing User Stories

• Story Sizing

• Splitting stories

• Agile planning

• Story Prioritization

• Determining value

• Techniques

• Story Estimation

• Product backlog

• Relative estimation vs time

Presentation Benefits

• Understand the realities of Agile requirements and User Stories

• Understand how they differ from other requirements techniques and how they fit into the arsenal of an IT BA

• Understand how to estimate User Stories

• Understand how to prioritize User Stories

Speaker: Rick Clare, CBAP, PMP, CSM, MSPM

Agenda

5:30 Sign in, light dinner (pizza or subs usually), get to know other BAs.
6:00 Introductions
6:15 BA Technique of the Month..NEW! We're going do 15 minutes a month promoting different BA techniques.
6:30 Presentation
7:30 Close

Fees
Chapter Members...FREE
Students.....................FREE
First Timers................FREE
Non-members...........$10

Because all our meetings are held in secure buildings with stern, no-nonsense security guards, complete with clipboards and guest lists, we need you to register on our chapter website for each meeting.

Pittsburgh.IIBA.org

Join us in April for our general membership meeting. Leo Vensel will be our guest speaker.
Leo Vensel started fly fishing in the early 70’s and is completely immersed in the sport. He has taught hundreds of students the fundamentals of fly fishing and truly enjoys guiding others in the pursuit of wild fish. His passion for the sport has taken him to the American west, Great Lakes, Florida, and the Mid-Atlantic. He is a fully insured, licensed Pennsylvania fishing guide, certified in CPR and First Aid, Federation of Fly Fishers certified casting instructor, and President Forbes Trail Chapter Trout Unlimited.

results.description:
Edward Joyce will delve into the nuts and bolts of home networks with an emphasis on:

·Evolution of the home network from modems to broadband to WiFi & focusing on optimal WiFi reception.

·Troubleshooting the home network. When the Internet is ‘down’ is it the ISP, your home connection, your computer, the web site or something else?

·Secrets of cable modems. How to access ‘hidden’ diagnostic information.

Come solo or with friends to the Ace Hotel Gym and throw down on games of dodgeball from 7pm-9pm, then form a team for the bracket tournament from 9pm-10pm. Win fabulous prizes, have a drink, get some exercise, and pummel your friends on Monday night.
